title: Campus Graduate – 2023 Finance Summer Internship
description:
About AMEX
At American Express, we know that with the right backing, people, and businesses, we have the power to progress in incredible ways. Whether we’re supporting our customers’ financial confidence to move ahead, taking commerce to new heights, or encouraging people to explore the world, our colleagues are constantly redefining what’s possible — and we’re proud to back each other every step of the way. Join #TeamAmex and let’s lead the way together.
Our industry is rapidly evolving, and we need courageous, quick thinkers who can shape the strategic decisions that lead our business forward. Whether it’s negotiating with some of our largest global partners or creating next year’s financial plan, you can influence both our day-to-day P&L and the future direction of the company. As part of the team, you can have the opportunity to learn and use the latest data tools and technologies and explore a range of roles to grow your career.
Business Unit/Role Specific Info
The internship will be a general Finance internship that will provide opportunities to intern in one of the following functional areas of Finance: Corporate Planning & Analysis, Global Commercial Services Finance, Global Consumer Services Group Finance, Global Merchant and Network Finance, Controllership, Global Treasury, and Investor Relations. 
What Type of Work Will I Do As an Intern?
All interns receive a project solving a real business challenge for the organization. Examples of past projects include:
Leveraging big data and SQL to understand American Express Card Member spending behavior in certain industries, across different markets and among certain merchants to ascertain growth opportunities
Business-to-Business (B2B) Industry Overview and recommendation of potential acquisition targets across markets
Assessing the efficiency of acquiring US Consumer Card Members through the Direct Mail acquisition channel
Creation of prototype to enable financial analysis on mobile products
Analysis of the profitability of our U.S. Small Merchants
Enhancements to Comprehensive Capital Analysis & Review (CCAR) Stress Testing Analytics as part of annual Federal Reserve Board submission
Skills/Experience:
Analytical Skills – ability to manipulate large amounts of data, spot trends & generate meaningful insights
Communication Skills – synthesize data into an easy-to-understand story & articulate key messages across multiple audiences
Agile Mindset – positive, can-do attitude, adapt to change, and highly motivated self-starter
Leadership – act & lead with courage, build relationships, make decisions quickly & influence change
Requirements/Qualifications
Currently enrolled in a full-time MBA degree program
Students must have a graduation date between December 2023 and June 2024
The final application deadline is Friday December 2nd at 11:59PM ET.
Depending on factors such as business unit requirements, the nature of the position, cost and applicable laws, American Express may provide visa sponsorship for certain positions.
American Express is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran status, disability status, age, or any other status protected by law.  
We back our colleagues with the support they need to thrive, professionally and personally. That's why we have Amex Flex, our enterprise working model that provides greater flexibility to colleagues while ensuring we preserve the important aspects of our unique in-person culture. Depending on role and business needs, colleagues will either work onsite, in a hybrid model (combination of in-office and virtual days) or fully virtually.

title: Senior Manager - Pricing Strategy
description:
You Lead the Way. We’ve Got Your Back.
With the right backing, people and businesses have the power to progress in incredible ways. When you join Team Amex, you become part of a global and diverse community of colleagues with an unwavering commitment to back our customers, communities and each other. Here, you’ll learn and grow as we help you create a career journey that’s unique and meaningful to you with benefits, programs, and flexibility that support you personally and professionally.
  At American Express, you’ll be recognized for your contributions, leadership, and impact—every colleague has the opportunity to share in the company’s success. Together, we’ll win as a team, striving to uphold our company values and powerful backing promise to provide the world’s best customer experience every day. And we’ll do it with the utmost integrity, and in an environment where everyone is seen, heard and feels like they belong.
  Join Team Amex and let's lead the way together.
  Global Lending and Cobrand, a business unit within the Global Consumer Services Group at American Express, is responsible for accelerating growth in our lending, lending on charge and cobrand portfolios to meet our customers’ evolving buying and payment needs while diversifying revenue streams and driving top line growth. It leads company’s efforts to run our relationships with cobrand partners and expand our suite of consumer lending products bringing deep expertise to deliver products, services, and strategies that will enhance our competitive position in each of our markets globally.
  How will you make an impact in this role?
  This Senior Manager role will report to the Director, U.S. Consumer Acquisition Pricing. This position will be responsible for developing and innovating new strategies across acquisition decisions and work closely with key partners across different functions and across different levels of seniority.
  The Senior Manager will also be responsible for crafting and implementing innovative acquisition pricing strategies for U.S. Consumer Cards to meet customer payment needs, enhance the customer experience, reduce operational complexity, improve compliance with applicable regulations, and support the company’s financial roadmap
  The responsibilities will include a mix of conceptualization, product development, and project management. Specific responsibilities include:
Innovate new strategies to improve Card Member acquisition decisions (E.g., investment allocation, Initial line, underwriting, and targeting)
Develop analytics to support prospect acquisition strategies
Run Senior level Steering Group that oversees acquisition decision engines
Present insights and recommendations to senior leaders to help shape strategy
Form effective linkages with business partners including Marketing, Risk, Enterprise Digital & Analytics, Finance
Lead cross functional team to execute Pricing changes in marketplace
  Qualifications
Ability to build strong relationships and collaborate across different functional teams across different levels of seniority
Experience developing cost benefit analyses and strong understanding of net present value concepts and calculations
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to leverage large data sets to inform business decisions
Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously
High quality written and oral communication skills
Understanding of credit card economics and overall business model
Strong strategic thought leadership to identify business needs and drive towards solutions for those needs
Innovative thinker and creative problem-solver who is able and willing to challenge the status quo
Strong will-to-win, intellectual curiosity, drive to do what it takes to meet deadlines with a “can do” attitude
Graduate level education with analytical focus (e.g. Econometrics, Applied Statistics/Operations Research, Engineering, etc.)
Hands-on expertise using statistical analysis and data manipulation software/tools (e.g. SAS, SQL, and Big Data analytic techniques)
  Salary Range: $80,000.00 to $155,000.00 annually + bonus + benefits
  The above represents the expected salary range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we'll consider your location, experience, and other job-related factors.
  American Express is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran status, disability status, age, or any other status protected by law.
  We back our colleagues with the support they need to thrive, professionally and personally. That's why we have Amex Flex, our enterprise working model that provides greater flexibility to colleagues while ensuring we preserve the important aspects of our unique in-person culture. Depending on role and business needs, colleagues will either work onsite, in a hybrid model (combination of in-office and virtual days) or fully virtually.

title: Campus Undergraduate 2023 Kabbage Summer Internship
description:
About AMEX
At American Express, we know that with the right backing, people and businesses have the power to progress in incredible ways. Whether we’re supporting our customers’ financial confidence to move ahead, taking commerce to new heights, or encouraging people to explore the world, our colleagues are constantly redefining what’s possible— and we’re proud to back each other every step of the way.
Join #TeamAmex and let’s lead the way together.
Kabbage is blazing a trail in big data & fintech and we are looking for interns to help us in our mission to help small businesses be mighty.
Acquired by American Express in 2020, Kabbage is a leading FinTech company changing the way small businesses manage their cash flow. Applying automation and real-time data, Kabbage provides small businesses a suite of integrated cash-flow technologies from flexible lines of credit, digital business checking accounts, fast payments and predictive business analytics. Now with the powerful backing of American Express, Kabbage can offer millions of small businesses the opportunity to access digital tools to help them grow bigger, lasting companies. While we've received numerous awards and recognition—such as Entrepreneur's Top Company Cultures, GlassDoor’s Best Places to Work, and Forbes FinTech 50—it is our people, our culture, and our leaders that make Kabbage such a great place to work.
  We’re visionaries and brand experts. Story-tellers and problem-solvers. For more than 160 years, American Express has been at the forefront of finance, industry, and innovation, backing our Card Members as they move forward and helping our customers do more of what matters most to them.
  What roles are open under Kabbage?
Marketing
Operations
UX & Product
Data Science
  Marketing - Kabbage’s Marketing team is a close-knit group that supports teams across the organization in pursuit of one goal: connecting small businesses with the financial solutions they need to grow. We’re responsible for building brand awareness, acquiring customers and increasing their lifetime value. We make sure our press outreach, advertising, emails, and social media support our customers and partners and tell a cohesive Kabbage story.
  Operations - Kabbage’s Servicing Team manages the systems that keep the company’s operational teams up and running. We work across all of Kabbage’s financial products to support sales, marketing, customer service, collections, risk, and other teams and ensure that they have the tools they need to grow the business and deliver the best experiences to Kabbage customers.
  UX & Product - You’ll be working alongside product designers, content strategists and product managers aimed to provide small businesses with the financial tools they need to enhance their cash flow. The team is highly collaborative, passionate, fast-paced and customer-focused.
  Data Science – Our data scientists are focused on building the models that make our platform run. You would work alongside machine learning experts, analytical creatives, and data gurus.
  Skills/Experience
Takes a project from ideation to delivery. Able to prioritize in ambiguous situations.
Strives to deliver great products. Proactive, self-driven, curious, loves learning.
Utilizes sound interpersonal skills to navigate in a cross-functional setup.
Analyze operations for sales team and identify problem areas
Collaborate with engineers to develop solutions
Earn stakeholder buy-in and incorporate solutions into product roadmap
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Analytical skills: Likes learning and learns quickly.
For Data Science:
Experience with one or more database querying tools (SQL, R, Python, PySpark)
Experience with analytical tools and visualization software (e.g., Tableau, Looker)
Educational Requirements
Currently enrolled in full-time undergraduate degree program
Students must have a graduation date between December 2023 and June 2024
Life at American Express
American Express is known for backing our customers to help them achieve their goals and dreams, both big and small. At American Express, we’re changing the way people live and work through meaningful projects with real-world impact. When you join our team you can make a difference by improving the everyday lives of customers around the world.
  Growing great leaders is one of the things that sets American Express apart. Every employee has the opportunity—and is encouraged—to take their personal leadership to the next level through a wide variety of leadership and learning programs.
  Our colleagues and their families feel supported at every stage of their lives. We provide resources and benefits that help support their physical, financial and emotional well-being, such as our award-winning global corporate wellness program, Healthy Living, and many others including: 20 weeks of Paid Parental Leave (to be eligible, employees must complete at least one year of continuous service immediately prior to the birth or placement of the child), Health (dental and vision) and Life Insurance, Tuition Reimbursement, and 401k with match. Some of our roles even offer flexible work arrangements so you can work how it makes sense for you, without ever compromising quality.
  Creating an inclusive culture is both a part of who we are and what we do together. We value and embrace the diversity of thought, backgrounds and experiences of all our employees. Through our 15 Colleague Networks, participants can broaden their associations with other employees while expanding their knowledge of the business.
  Why American Express?
There’s a difference between having a job and making a difference.
  American Express has been making a difference in people’s lives for over 160 years, backing them in moments big and small, granting access, tools, and resources to take on their biggest challenges and reap the greatest rewards.
  We’ve also made a difference in the lives of our people, providing a culture of learning and collaboration, and helping them with what they need to succeed and thrive. We have their backs as they grow their skills, conquer new challenges, or even take time to spend with their family or community. And when they’re ready to take on a new career path, we’re right there with them, giving them the guidance and support.
  Because we believe that the best way to back our customers is to back our people.
  The powerful backing of American Express.
Don’t make a difference without it.
Don’t live life without it.
  Learn more about our opportunities at American Express by visiting https://careers.americanexpress.com.
    United States Only:
American Express is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran status, disability status, age, or any other status protected by law.  
We back our colleagues with the support they need to thrive, professionally and personally. That's why we have Amex Flex, our enterprise working model that provides greater flexibility to colleagues while ensuring we preserve the important aspects of our unique in-person culture. Depending on role and business needs, colleagues will either work onsite, in a hybrid model (combination of in-office and virtual days) or fully virtually.
  US Job Seekers/Employees - Click here to view the “EEO is the Law” poster and supplement and the Pay Transparency Policy Statement.
If the links do not work, please copy and paste the following URLs in a new browser window: https://www.dol.gov/agencies/ofccp/posters to access the three posters.
Salary Range: $55,000.00 to $105,000.00 annually + bonus + benefits
The above represents the expected salary range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we'll consider your location, experience, and other job-related factors.

title: Technology Vendor Manager (Mainframe, Power BI)
description:
At American Express, we know that with the right backing, people and businesses have the power to progress in incredible ways. Whether we’re supporting our customers’ financial confidence to move ahead, taking commerce to new heights, or encouraging people to explore the world, our colleagues are constantly redefining what’s possible — and we’re proud to back each other every step of the way.
When you join Team Amex, you become part of a diverse community of over 60,000 colleagues, all with a common goal to deliver an exceptional customer experience every day. Here, you’ll learn and grow as we champion your meaningful career journey with programs, benefits, and flexibility to back you personally and professionally. Every colleague share in the company’s success.
Together, we’ll win as a team, striving to uphold our company values and powerful backing promise to our customers, communities, and each other every day. And we’ll do it with integrity and in an environment where everyone is seen, heard and feels like they truly belong.
Join #TeamAmex and let’s lead the way together.
How will you make an impact in this role?
Technology Vendor Manager for the Vendor Charge Management Team within AET Vendor and Business Management Organization. Primary role will be to lead the validation of Kyndryl invoicing for Mainframe 3rd Party Software, manage a significant amount of data, continue creating efficiencies and automation of processes, support operational mapping of Mainframe cost components, ad-hoc projects and product reporting.
Responsibilities:
Serve as the lead for the financial analysis and reporting of Mainframe third party software.
Validate billing of various software vendors, engage in approval process of new software, evaluate cost impact of capacity increases, and participate in action based save projects.
Manage complex data utilizing SQL, sourcing information from multiple sources including mainframe databases and providing output to a variety of customers.
Maintain mapping tables currently in Access by working with peers and across multiple organizations. 
Implement a new data warehouse self-serve tool for customers to obtain financial Mainframe data in support of cost saves and reengineering opportunities.
Identify new opportunities for managing operational mapping, improve SQL processes and increase data processes efficiencies.
Works with the Finance & TCAI to ensure alignment of actuals, baselines, forecasts, and projection data across organizations.
Support the annual baseline forecast for Kyndryl invoice related to Mainframe Consumption
Provide support as needed towards other Mainframe ad-hoc inquiries, invoice validation and reporting processes.
Ability to present complex financial analysis and ratios to senior leadership
Works with contract labor partners to do rate card analysis and invoice reconciliation when required
 As part of our diverse tech team, you can architect, code and ship software that makes us an essential part of our customers’ digital lives. Here, you can work alongside talented engineers in an open, supportive, inclusive environment where your voice is valued, and you make your own decisions on what tech to use to solve challenging problems. Amex offers a range of opportunities to work with the latest technologies and encourages you to back the broader engineering community through open source. And because we understand the importance of keeping your skills fresh and relevant, we give you dedicated time to invest in your professional development. Find your place in technology on #TeamAmex.
Minimum Qualifications
Advanced experience with Power BI, Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint and SQL experience required
Ability to manage a significant volume of complex data
Strong collaboration skills in working as a team of 3 to support the Mainframe billing tower within SCM and across multiple organizations supporting Mainframe.
Requires strong analytical skills, financial acumen and reporting
Proven collaboration skills along with the ability to influence without authority
Ability to be assertive and challenge the status quo, while still maintaining strong and effective relationships
Ability to communicate with multiple levels of leadership.
Ability to use business and technical experience to identify impacts or risks and create plans to mitigate them
Proven ability to effectively manage multiple competing priorities, including planning, management and execution of responsibilities
Holds a Bachelor's Degree or Masters in Accounting, Finance, Computer Science, Information Systems, Business Administration, or other related field or has the equivalent work experience
Experience working directly with third-party vendors or other vendor management preferred
Salary Range: $110,000.00 to $190,000.00 annually + bonus + benefits
The above represents the expected salary range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we'll consider your location, experience, and other job-related factors.
American Express is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran status, disability status, age, or any other status protected by law.
We back our colleagues with the support they need to thrive, professionally and personally. That's why we have Amex Flex, our enterprise working model that provides greater flexibility to colleagues while ensuring we preserve the important aspects of our unique in-person culture. Depending on role and business needs, colleagues will either work onsite, in a hybrid model (combination of in-office and virtual days) or fully virtually.
US Job Seekers/Employees - Click here to view the “EEO is the Law” poster and supplement and the Pay Transparency Policy Statement.
If the links do not work, please copy and paste the following URLs in a new browser window: https://www.dol.gov/agencies/ofccp/posters to access the three posters.
Employment eligibility to work with American Express in the U.S. is required as the company will not pursue visa sponsorship for these positions.

title: Senior Engineer - Full Stack
description:
At American Express, we know that with the right backing, people and businesses have the power to progress in incredible ways. Whether we’re supporting our customers’ financial confidence to move ahead, taking commerce to new heights, or encouraging people to explore the world, our colleagues are constantly redefining what’s possible — and we’re proud to back each other every step of the way.
When you join Team Amex, you become part of a diverse community of over 60,000 colleagues, all with a common goal to deliver an exceptional customer experience every day. Here, you’ll learn and grow as we champion your meaningful career journey with programs, benefits, and flexibility to back you personally and professionally. Every colleague shares in the company’s success.
Together, we’ll win as a team, striving to uphold our company values and powerful backing promise to our customers, communities, and each other every day. And, we’ll do it with integrity and in an environment where everyone is seen, heard and feels like they truly belong.
Join #TeamAmex and let’s lead the way together.
You will be leading of a fast-paced, entrepreneurial team responsible for delivering world class Omnichannel payment experiences and personal integration through REST on vert.x polyglot event-driven application framework and data driven solution on Big Data stack, Machine Learning and APIs. You will be challenged with identifying innovative and transformative ideas and proof of concept to deliver against the existing and future needs of our customers.
We are looking for passionate Digital / Web Senior engineer to work and lead team on the futuristic web engineering, Digital asset creation & API integration for our clients & partners. This requires the ability to go deep in the American Express payment system with many dependencies while responsible for the technical deliveries and implementation of components. As a Senior engineer in our OPEN SOURCE development team you will be responsible for lead, develop and deliver digital experience for the future supporting AMEX user experiences on Omnichannel (web, bot,mobile, etc.), as well as integrations with partners. Strong on Cloud technology implementation private and public / hybrid domains. Senior Engineer lead POCs, MVP using open source , American express frameworks like OneAmex , Cloud Event schema for event architecture.
You will work closely with product and experience to understand the requirements and deliver product that meets these requirements. Technologies used vary from Java, Spring, REST, REACT, Angular, SPRING, Node.js, SPARK, SCALA, HIVE , Python etc. If you are the kind of lead engineer who is passionate about bringing great products to life especially in payment area, being a crafts(wo)man in engineering and love working in a collaborative environment with your product partners and dependency teams, then we want to talk to you.
Responsibilities:
Perform all technical aspects of software development for assigned applications including design, hands-on engineering, developing framework & tooling including prototypes, and code review, mentor engineering peers and own and drive transformation with various technology domains.
Experience designing and developing REST APIs for high volume clients.
Experience with relational and NoSQL databases, including PostgreSQL, MongoDb, Couchbase, or Cassandra is a plus.
Function as a engineering leader on an agile team to build scalable software solutions through consistent development practices (tools, common components, and documentation).
Lead code reviews (Pull Requests)
Lead and contribute into engineering excellence like automated of all testing areas.
Lead Product Management and work closely with product owners in defining product and engineering roadmap.
Debug software components and identify code defects for remediation.
Leads the deployment, support, and monitoring of software across test, integration, and production environments.
Automate deployments in test or production environments.
Goal to have all applications able automatically scale and non functional requirements of self-healing built within every critical journeys
Strong interpersonal leadership
Demonstrate increased self-reliance to achieve team goals.
Influence team members with innovative changes and improvements by challenging status quo and demonstrating risk taking.
Be a productivity multiplier for your team by analyzing your workflow and contributing to enable the team to be more effective, productive, and demonstrating faster and stronger results.
Mentor and guide team members to success within the team.
Minimum Qualifications: 
Bachelor's Degree in computer science or information technology
8 + years of software development experience
6 + years of experience with cloud-based software design, building microservices, and automated testing and deployment
6 + years of experience with distributed (multi-tiered) systems, algorithms, and relational databases
8 + years of experience in developing Java, REST , REACT , SPRING applications and solutions
8 + years of experience in core Java development / design / architecture
Preferred Qualifications:
Up to date with industry reference of tech trend and solutions.
Thinking leader in building innovation and transformational technology strategies
Enable engineering teams to adapt and promote OpenSource
2 + years of experience with Big Data Tech stack of technologies
2 + years of experience in designing and building solutions using Kafka streams or queues 
2 + years of experience or exposure to Machine Learning and Artificial Engineering would be beneficial.
Master's Degree

Lead and contribute into engineering excellence like automated of all testing areas.
Lead Product Management and work closely with product owners in defining product and engineering roadmap.
Debug software components and identify code defects for remediation.
Leads the deployment, support, and monitoring of software across test, integration, and production environments.
Automate deployments in test or production environments.
Goal to have all applications able automatically scale and non functional requirements of self-healing built within every critical journeys
Strong interpersonal leadership
Demonstrate increased self-reliance to achieve team goals.
Influence team members with innovative changes and improvements by challenging status quo and demonstrating risk taking.
Be a productivity multiplier for your team by analyzing your workflow and contributing to enable the team to be more effective, productive, and demonstrating faster and stronger results.
Mentor and guide team members to success within the team.', "Bachelor's Degree in computer science or information technology
8 + years of software development experience", '6 + years of experience with cloud-based software design, building microservices, and automated testing and deployment
6 + years of experience with distributed (multi-tiered) systems, algorithms, and relational databases
8 + years of experience in developing Java, REST , REACT , SPRING applications and solutions
8 + years of experience in core Java development / design / architecture', "Up to date with industry reference of tech trend and solutions.
Thinking leader in building innovation and transformational technology strategies
Enable engineering teams to adapt and promote OpenSource
2 + years of experience with Big Data Tech stack of technologies
2 + years of experience in designing and building solutions using Kafka streams or queues 
2 + years of experience or exposure to Machine Learning and Artificial Engineering would be beneficial.
Master's Degree"]

title: Senior Manager-Data Science
description:
At American Express, we know that with the right backing, people and businesses have the power to progress in incredible ways. Whether we’re supporting our customers’ financial confidence to move ahead, taking commerce to new heights, or encouraging people to explore the world, our colleagues are constantly redefining what’s possible — and we’re proud to back each other every step of the way.
When you join Team Amex, you become part of a diverse community of over 60,000 colleagues, all with a common goal to deliver an exceptional customer experience every day. Here, you’ll learn and grow as we champion your meaningful career journey with programs, benefits, and flexibility to back you personally and professionally. Every colleague share in the company’s success.
Together, we’ll win as a team, striving to uphold our company values and powerful backing promise to our customers, communities, and each other every day. And we’ll do it with integrity and in an environment where everyone is seen, heard and feels like they truly belong.
Join #TeamAmex and let’s lead the way together.
  We are seeking a candidate with specialties in Machine Learning and Data Science to join the Global Decision Science group at American Express. The incumbent will apply advanced analytics and machine learning techniques to develop models to support personal loan underwriting decision making as well as other emerging business opportunities in the company. He/she will interact with cross-functional teams spanning Risk, Marketing and Technology, and be responsible for the end-to-end model development and implementation.
This role will report to Director of Data Science with main responsibilities including:
Design, develop and implement models for emerging opportunities with Machine Learning techniques.
Communicate model algorithms and results to senior leaders and business partners.
R&D on new Machine Learning techniques and their applications in risk management.
  Advanced degree in quantitative field related to machine learning, such as Mathematics, Statistics, Machine Learning, Pattern Recognition, or Operation Research, is required.
Hands-on experience in machine learning algorithm development or application.
Experience in large data processing and handling.
Familiar with big data platform and its applications, such as Hadoop, Pig, Hive, and Spark.
Master at least one popular programming language (e.g., Python/R, Java, Scala, C++).
Familiarity with credit card and/or installment loan industry is a plus.
Strong communication skills, able to explain complex algorithm and results to business partners in simple terms.
Ability to work in a dynamic, cross-functional environment, with a strong attention to detail.
Ability to work independently yet being a team player.
 
  Salary Range: $90,000.00 to $165,000.00 annually + bonus + benefits
The above represents the expected salary range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we'll consider your location, experience, and other job-related factors.
American Express is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran status, disability status, age, or any other status protected by law.
We back our colleagues with the support they need to thrive, professionally and personally. That’s why we have Amex Flex, our enterprise working model that provides greater flexibility to colleagues while ensuring we preserve the important aspects of our unique in-person culture. Depending on role and business needs, colleagues will either work onsite, in a hybrid model (combination of in-office and virtual days) or fully virtually.

title: Campus Graduate 2023 Credit & Fraud Risk Strategy & Analytics Summer Internship
description:
About AMEX 
At American Express, we know that with the right backing, people and businesses have the power to progress in incredible ways. Whether we’re supporting our customers’ financial confidence to move ahead, taking commerce to new heights, or encouraging people to explore the world, our colleagues are constantly redefining what’s possible— and we’re proud to back each other every step of the way.  
Join #TeamAmex and let’s lead the way together. 
  How we serve our customers is constantly evolving and is a challenge we gladly accept. Whether you’re finding new ways to prevent identity fraud or enabling customers to start a new business, you can work with one of the most valuable data sets in the world to identify insights and actions that can have a meaningful impact on our customers and our business. And, with opportunities to learn from leaders who have defined the course of our industry, you can grow your career and define your own path.  
  Business Unit/Role Specific Info 
Credit & Fraud Risk:  
This key team is responsible for managing enterprise risks throughout the customer lifecycle, across our consumer and commercial businesses, and across all our global products. We develop industry-first data capabilities, build profitable decision-making frameworks, create machine learning-powered predictive models, and improve customer servicing strategies.  
  Credit Risk Strategy: The credit risk team supervises credit portfolios and optimizes profit-based risk management decisions at all stages of the customer credit lifecycle.  
Fraud Risk Strategy: The team analyzes and improves controls across all points of business that build fraud vulnerabilities, including product and service design, account acquisition, card issuance, servicing, and financial transactions.  
  The specific job responsibilities would depend on the team you are selected in for a summer internship role. Broadly the role could entail some of the below listed responsibilities:  
  Partner closely with our Digital Product and Business Unit teams to provide insights which inform product development and marketing investment decisions as well as actionable, insightful analytical solutions to help the leadership team evaluate and drive business performance  
Collaborate extensively with colleagues to design and implement strategies based on statistical, financial and economic analysis  
Provide analytical support to enable billing, revenue growth, profitability and customer experience through diverse projects  
Integrate new data sources and capabilities to drive key business decisions  
  Skills/Experience  
Passion for improving end-to-end customer experience, innovation and customer first thinking  
Strong interest in digital space and ability to collaborate with technology and product partners  
Independent thinker who’s organized, has great attention to detail, and can multi-task while still taking into account the big picture  
Strong analytical and decision-making skills – must have the ability to compile, analyze, research, and link complex issues  
Demonstrated ability to work effectively and collaboratively in high pressure situations and handle multiple priority assignments simultaneously – must be a self-starter  
Excellent written and verbal skills, with the ability to effectively communicate at all levels  
Willingness to learn and master new systems  
Knowledge of MS Office applications required  
Knowledge of SQL, SAS, Java, Hive, Yellow Brick, or Python is a plus  
  Requirements/Qualifications  
Currently enrolled in full-time graduate degree program  
Students must have a graduation date between December 2023 and June 2024  
United States Only:
American Express is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran status, disability status, age, or any other status protected by law.  
We back our colleagues with the support they need to thrive, professionally and personally. That's why we have Amex Flex, our enterprise working model that provides greater flexibility to colleagues while ensuring we preserve the important aspects of our unique in-person culture. Depending on role and business needs, colleagues will either work onsite, in a hybrid model (combination of in-office and virtual days) or fully virtually.
  US Job Seekers/Employees - Click here to view the “EEO is the Law” poster and supplement and the Pay Transparency Policy Statement.
If the links do not work, please copy and paste the following URLs in a new browser window: https://www.dol.gov/agencies/ofccp/posters to access the three posters.
Salary Range: $80,000.00 to $155,000.00 annually + bonus + benefits
The above represents the expected salary range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we'll consider your location, experience, and other job-related factors.

title: Engineer- Java/Machine Learning
description:
You Lead the Way. We’ve Got Your Back. At American Express, we know that with the right backing, people and businesses have the power to progress in incredible ways. Whether we’re supporting our customers’ financial confidence to move ahead, taking commerce to new heights, or encouraging people to explore the world, our colleagues are constantly redefining what’s possible — and we’re proud to back each other every step of the way. When you join #TeamAmex, you become part of a diverse community of over 60,000 colleagues, all with a common goal to deliver an exceptional customer experience every day.
From building next-generation apps and microservices in Kotlin to using AI to help protect our customers from fraud, you could be doing transformational work that brings our iconic, global brand into the future. As a part of our tech team, we could work together to bring ground-breaking and diverse ideas to life that power the digital systems, services, products and platforms that millions of customers around the world depend on. If you love to work with APIs, contribute to open source, or use the latest technologies, we’ll support you with an open environment and learning culture to grow your career.
 
 Focus:
Contributes to design, development, troubleshooting, debugging, evaluating, modifying, deploying, and documenting software and systems that meet the needs of customer-facing applications, business applications, and/or internal end user applications.
Organizational Context:
Entry-level hire, member of a product engineering or delivery and integration team reporting to a Senior Engineer, Engineering Director or Director Product Delivery & Integration.
How will you make an impact in this role? 
Beginner level ability in software development, such coding assignments.
Function as member of an agile team by contributing to software builds through consistent development practices (tools, common components, and documentation).
Demonstrate increased self-reliance to achieve team goals.
Participate in code reviews and automated testing.
Debug basic software components and identify code defects for remediation.
Enable the deployment, support, and monitoring of software across test, integration, and production environments.
Automate deployments in test or production environments.
Automatically scale applications based on demand projections.
Range of Impact/Influence:
Accountable for team completing work you’re leading and work you are doing as agreed upon.
Accountable to team for delivery of quality work.
As part of our diverse tech team, you can architect, code and ship software that makes us an essential part of our customers’ digital lives. Here, you can work alongside talented engineers in an open, supportive, inclusive environment where your voice is valued, and you make your own decisions on what tech to use to solve challenging problems. Amex offers a range of opportunities to work with the latest technologies and encourages you to back the broader engineering community through open source. And because we understand the importance of keeping your skills fresh and relevant, we give you dedicated time to invest in your professional development. Find your place in technology on #TeamAmex.
2+ years of Software Development experience, with Production support or Ops experience a plus (not critical).
Preferably a BS or MS Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or other technical discipline.
Strong programming skills in Java, Python, or both.
Hands-on experience with the following technologies: Java or Python, Preferred knowledge on Big Data – Spark/Hive/Hbase, SQL/NoSQL.
Deep code analysis skills with the goal being proactive platform improvement.
Expert Java; fluency with Java 8 streams.  Or, Familiar with one of the popular Machine Learning technologies such as such as ScikitLearn, TensorFlow, Keras, XGBoost/Prophet, NLP, etc.
Knowledgebase with Core Java, Spring, Open source and building RESTful API and services.
Thorough understanding of XML, JSON, Web Service technologies, and data structure fundamentals.
Implementation or working experience of Continuous Integration and Continues Delivery using tools and automation capabilities such as JUnit, Mocking, TestNG, Jenkins, Git, Stash and Jira.
Knowledgebase in SQL or Oracle PL/SQL development and troubleshooting skills.
Ability to perform Root Cause Analysis and determine short term and long-term fixes extremely fast.
Good understanding of Change Management, Problem Management and Incident Management processes a plus.
Willingness to learn new Technologies and exploit them to their optimal potential.
Able to understand and use complex data structures and associated components.
Designs, codes, tests, maintains, and documents applications.
Familiar with GIT.
Ability to effectively interpret technical and business objectives. 
We back our colleagues with the support they need to thrive, professionally and personally. That’s why we have Amex Flex, our enterprise working model that provides greater flexibility to colleagues while ensuring we preserve the important aspects of our unique in-person culture. Depending on role and business needs, colleagues will either work onsite, in a hybrid model (combination of in-office and virtual days) or fully virtually.
Employment eligibility to work with American Express in the U.S. is required as the company will not pursue visa sponsorship for these positions.
American Express is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, age, or any other status protected by law.
Salary Range: $85,000.00 to $150,000.00 annually + bonus + benefits
The above represents the expected salary range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we'll consider your location, experience, and other job-related factors.

description:
You Lead the Way. We’ve Got Your Back.
At American Express, we know that with the right backing, people and businesses have the power to progress in incredible ways. Whether we’re supporting our customers’ financial confidence to move ahead, taking commerce to new heights, or encouraging people to explore the world, our colleagues are constantly redefining what’s possible — and we’re proud to back each other every step of the way. When you join #TeamAmex, you become part of a diverse community of over 60,000 colleagues, all with a common goal to deliver an exceptional customer experience every day.
 Where are these roles located within American Express?  
How we serve our customers is constantly evolving and is a challenge we gladly accept. Whether you’re finding new ways to prevent identity fraud or enabling customers to start a new business, you can work with one of the most valuable data sets in the world to identify insights and actions that can have a meaningful impact on our customers and our business. And, with opportunities to learn from leaders who have defined the course of our industry, you can grow your career and define your own path.  
Enterprise Digital & Data Solutions (EDDS): Internship opportunity for someone who wants to help shape, refine and build Prospect and Customer digital connections, experiences and interactions for one of the world’s most respected companies, through advanced statistical techniques, AI, and machine learning. Enterprise Digital & Data Solutions team charter is to be an engine of growth, marketplace differentiation and efficiency for American Express. 
 The Product Analytics Responsibilities 
Working in close collaboration with enterprise platform teams, technologies, and vendor partners to ingest rich data into our digital marketing capabilities 
Supporting multivariate and a/b testing to drive value for the business. Incorporating statistical robustness and advancements in experiment design and study 
Using data from various sources to generate user-centered analyses to influence stakeholders on customer experience improvements that will drive higher conversion for various user segments 
Awareness of developments in the field of digital analytics for the e-commerce space and recommending changes in tools, platforms, or methodologies 
  Partner closely with our Digital Product and Business Unit teams to provide insights which inform product development and marketing investment decisions as well as actionable, insightful analytical solutions to help the leadership team evaluate and drive business performance

Excellent written and verbal skills, with the ability to effectively communicate at all levels

title: Staff Engineer - Kotlin / Java / Javascript - Enterprise GraphQL Services
description:
You Lead the Way. We’ve Got Your Back.
At American Express, we know that with the right backing, people and businesses have the power to progress in incredible ways. Whether we’re supporting our customers’ financial confidence to move ahead, taking commerce to new heights, or encouraging people to explore the world, our colleagues are constantly redefining what’s possible — and we’re proud to back each other every step of the way. When you join #TeamAmex, you become part of a diverse community of over 60,000 colleagues, all with a common goal to deliver an exceptional customer experience every day.
Our Staff Engineers not only understand how technology works, but how that technology helps the people who count on it: our customers and colleagues. We are developing an enterprise-scale GraphQL service to power our customer experiences. Whether the customer is online using our JD Power award-winning web and mobile applications, on the phone with our legendary Customer Care Professionals, or chatting with us through Alexa, our GraphQL service will provide the data and functionality needed at the point of customer contact. Fast, secure, real-time, and seamlessly coordinated.
As part of our diverse tech team, you can architect, code and ship software that makes us a crucial part of our customers’ digital lives. Here, you can work alongside talented engineers in an open, encouraging, inclusive environment where your voice is valued, and you make your own decisions on what tech to use to tackle complicated problems. American Express offers a range of opportunities to work with the latest technologies and encourages you to back the broader engineering community through open source. And because we understand the importance of keeping your skills fresh and relevant, we give you dedicated time to invest in your professional development. Find your place in technology of #TeamAmex.
In this role, you will:
Ship code. Above all, our Staff Engineers are active, hands-on engineers. You will work on exciting, sophisticated problems related to building an enterprise-scale GraphQL service that underpins the experience of millions of customers globally
Embody a Site Reliability Engineering approach to software delivery (alerts, paging, telemetry, incident management, threat-detection)
Be part of the platform leadership team. Our GraphQL service is entering a phase of significant growth and investment, and you will be at the forefront setting technical strategy and encouraging an inclusive, innovative team culture
Be a leading light in our engineering community, helping other engineers to reach their full potential
Find opportunities to innovate and adopt new technologies
Feel empowered and supported every step of the way by leaders and peers who want you to succeed
As a director-level engineer, potentially lead a small team of software engineers
Collaborate and build positive relationships with senior stakeholders, product partners, and cross-functional technology teams
Take risks, experiment, learn, and adapt quickly
Technical Skills
Required:
Systems Design: designing systems that are fast, reliable, and secure at high scale. Deep understanding of application, infrastructure, and network components (API gateways, load balancers, reverse proxies, caches…) and how to combine them effectively in on-premises, on-cloud, and hybrid settings
Security: deep understanding of security concepts and how to implement them
Modelling: aptitude for analysing and modelling complex business domains, and constructing domain and data models (for example, UML class diagrams, ER diagrams) that help our API data structures evolve cohesively
Coding: recent, expert, hands-on experience building applications and services with a JVM-based language (Java, Kotlin) or Javascript
Testing frameworks: experience using testing frameworks
Code versioning: experience with using code versioning systems, preferably git.
Agile methodologies: experience working within Scrum, Kanban, or XP variant.
Desirable:
GraphQL: designing GraphQL schemas and resolver functions that scale well. Optimizing GraphQL execution, for example through batching, caching, and look ahead. Empathy for what makes a GraphQL API a phenomenal product
Additional languages, to demonstrate your deep understanding of programming paradigms
Docker/Kubernetes – experience building and deploying cloud native applications
Databases - experience of NoSQL or SQL databases such as PostgreSQL, Cassandra, or caches such as Redis, Memcached
CI/CD - experience in building pipelines for continue integration and delivery: Git, Jenkins, etc.
Spring - experience with the Spring framework, specifically Spring Boot
Reactive - Experience with Spring Webflux /vert.x or similar RX architectures
Minimum Qualifications:
Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree in Computer Science or related disciplines is preferred, but not crucial. Demonstrable mastery of modern technology architecture, infrastructure, and software practices is crucial.
5+ years software development experience
Salary Range: $170,000.00 to $255,000.00 annually + sales incentive + equity (if applicable) + benefits
The above represents the expected salary range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we'll consider your location, experience, and other job-related factors.
American Express is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, age, or any other status protected by law.
We back our colleagues with the support they need to thrive, professionally and personally. That’s why we have Amex Flex, our enterprise working model that provides greater flexibility to colleagues while ensuring we preserve the important aspects of our unique in-person culture. Depending on role and business needs, colleagues will either work onsite, in a hybrid model (combination of in-office and virtual days) or fully virtually.

Modelling: aptitude for analysing and modelling complex business domains, and constructing domain and data models (for example, UML class diagrams, ER diagrams) that help our API data structures evolve cohesively
Coding: recent, expert, hands-on experience building applications and services with a JVM-based language (Java, Kotlin) or Javascript
Testing frameworks: experience using testing frameworks
Code versioning: experience with using code versioning systems, preferably git.
Agile methodologies: experience working within Scrum, Kanban, or XP variant.', 'GraphQL: designing GraphQL schemas and resolver functions that scale well. Optimizing GraphQL execution, for example through batching, caching, and look ahead. Empathy for what makes a GraphQL API a phenomenal product
Additional languages, to demonstrate your deep understanding of programming paradigms
Docker/Kubernetes – experience building and deploying cloud native applications
Databases - experience of NoSQL or SQL databases such as PostgreSQL, Cassandra, or caches such as Redis, Memcached
CI/CD - experience in building pipelines for continue integration and delivery: Git, Jenkins, etc.
Spring - experience with the Spring framework, specifically Spring Boot
Reactive - Experience with Spring Webflux /vert.x or similar RX architectures', 'Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree in Computer Science or related disciplines is preferred, but not crucial. Demonstrable mastery of modern technology architecture, infrastructure, and software practices is crucial.
5+ years software development experience']
salary_range: $170,000.00 to $255,000.00 annually + sales incentive + equity (if applicable)

title: Senior Product Manager - Enterprise Data Platform
description:
You Lead the Way. We’ve Got Your Back.
  At American Express, we know that with the right backing, people and businesses have the power to progress in incredible ways.  Whether we’re supporting our customers’ financial confidence to move ahead, taking commerce to new heights, or encouraging people to explore the world, our colleagues are constantly redefining what’s possible - and we’re proud to back each other every step of the way. When you join #TeamAmex, you become part of a diverse community of over 60,000 colleagues, all with a common goal to deliver an exceptional customer experience every day
  The Enterprise Data Platforms (EDP) organization is part of the American Express Enterprise Digital and Data Solutions (EDDS) Group.  EDP manages the Big Data Ecosystem which helps to centralize data across the company with built-in governance and democratization of access to a broad user community. The team is driving the future of our business by building products and platforms that delivers trusted and quality data for decision science processes, big data applications and analytical users. 
We are looking for a Product Manager for our Data Platform Solutions team within the Enterprise Data Platforms organization. This role works closely with Business, Technology, and Infrastructure partners to address user challenges and drive solutions to modernize the enterprise data platform.
  Primary Responsibilities:
Understand the current on-prem big data platform landscape, architect the target state architecture, and execute the modernization roadmap to public cloud infrastructure
Define the product vision and strategy for the cloud capabilities in close partnership with technology teams and business stakeholders across the enterprise
Collaborate with product teams, solution team and technology partners to deliver customer centric solutions best tailored to AXP colleague and customer needs
Champion an external perspective in delivering solutions via a deep understanding of the external landscape; inspire and infuse external perspective across workstreams to modernize the platform
Drive large-scale enterprise programs such as Cloud transformation where developing data and migration strategy is required
Develop presentations and communicate with various levels of leadership across the enterprise
Identify needs, opportunities, gaps, and resolve customer challenges with EDP product offerings and enhancements
  5+ years of product owner experience in driving agile development processes to deliver new product asks
Strong understanding of products and services in GCP platform, cloud technology, streaming solutions, and third-party cloud products
Knowledge of big data platform architecture, data management and newer developments in the industry
Highly organized and self-motivated individual who can combine problem-resolution, and critical thinking to apply a business lens to design customer-obsessed solutions
Inherent customer focus with an ability to interact with leaders at all levels of the organization
Possess a unique blend of business and technical savvy, excellent communication & collaboration skills; ability to build relationships, influence decisions, and inspire cross-functional teams to deliver on shared objectives
Confidence in decision-making in complex & ambiguous situations; comfortable troubleshooting and aligning conflicting interests
Degree in STEM fields with work experience in information management, strategy, or the payments business
We back our colleagues with the support they need to thrive, professionally and personally. That’s why we have Amex Flex, our enterprise working model that provides greater flexibility to colleagues while ensuring we preserve the important aspects of our unique in-person culture. Depending on role and business needs, colleagues will either work onsite, in a hybrid model (combination of in-office and virtual days) or fully virtually.
Employment eligibility to work with American Express in the U.S. is required as the company will not pursue visa sponsorship for these positions.
American Express is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, age, or any other status protected by law.

title: Senior Engineering Manager - Finance Technologies
description:
At American Express, we know that with the right backing, people and businesses have the power to progress in incredible ways. Whether we’re supporting our customers’ financial confidence to move ahead, taking commerce to new heights, or encouraging people to explore the world, our colleagues are constantly redefining what’s possible — and we’re proud to back each other every step of the way.
When you join Team Amex, you become part of a diverse community of over 60,000 colleagues, all with a common goal to deliver an exceptional customer experience every day. Here, you’ll learn and grow as we champion your meaningful career journey with programs, benefits, and flexibility to back you personally and professionally. Every colleague share in the company’s success.
Together, we’ll win as a team, striving to uphold our company values and powerful backing promise to our customers, communities, and each other every day. And we’ll do it with integrity and in an environment where everyone is seen, heard and feels like they truly belong.
Join #TeamAmex and let’s lead the way together.
The Finance Technology group at American Express is entering into a new phase of technology transformation driven by opportunities to simplify processes, deepen business intelligence, analytics and reporting, and raise operational efficiency. If you have the talent and desire to deliver innovative products and services at a rapid pace, with hands on experience and strategic thinking, in areas of data management and analytics, cloud computing, and modern software engineering, join our leadership team to be part of our transformation journey
I’m the principal engineer looking after finance technologies, and I’m looking for a passionate senior engineering manager to join my team. I have a wide range of scope, and I'm looking for someone with a strong knowledge of pipelines, CICD and Kotlin to join the team and drive change for my peers by demonstrating to their team's awesome engineering.
As part of our diverse tech team, you can architect, code and ship software that makes us an essential part of our customers’ digital lives. Here, you can work alongside talented engineers in an open, supportive, inclusive environment where your voice is valued, and you make your own decisions on what tech to use to solve challenging problems. Amex offers a range of opportunities to work with the latest technologies and encourages you to back the broader engineering community through open source. And because we understand the importance of keeping your skills fresh and relevant, we give you dedicated time to invest in your professional development. Find your place in technology on #TeamAmex.
Qualifications:
4-10 years of software development experience in a professional environment and/or comparable experience such as:
Familiar with Agile or other rapid application development methods
Experience with design and coding across one or more platforms and languages as appropriate
Hands-on expertise with application design, software development and automated testing
Experience with distributed (multi-tiered) systems, algorithms, and relational databases
Confirmed experience with object-oriented design and coding with variety of languages
Bachelor’s Degree in computer science, computer science engineering, or related experience required; advanced degree preferred
Expert knowledge on Informatica Designer, Workflow Manager and Workflow Monitor.
Awareness on Dimensional modelling concepts.
Strong knowledge on Oracle SQL, ETL performance tuning and unix scripting.
Ability to effectively collaborate with Finance SMEs and partners of all levels to understand their business processes and take overall ownership of Analysis, Design, Estimation and Delivery of technical solutions for Finance business requirements and roadmaps.
Software Development:
Ability in software development, such coding assignments
Function as member of an agile team by contributing to software builds through consistent development practices (tools, common components, and documentation)
Participate in code reviews and automated testing
Debug basic software components and identify code defects for remediation
Enable the deployment, support, and monitoring of software across test, integration, and production environments
Automate deployments in test or production environments
Automatically scale applications based on demand projections
Leadership:
Demonstrate increased self-reliance to achieve team goals
Influence team members with creative changes and improvements by challenging status quo and demonstrating risk taking
 Range of Impact/Influence:
Accountable for team completing work you’re leading and work you are doing as agreed upon
Accountable to team for delivery of quality work
Salary Range: $110,000.00 to $190,000.00 annually + bonus + benefits
The above represents the expected salary range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we'll consider your location, experience, and other job-related factors.
American Express is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran status, disability status, age, or any other status protected by law.

title: Senior Engineer – Java – Enterprise Real-Time Processing
description:
You Lead the Way. We’ve Got Your Back.
At American Express, we know that with the right backing, people and businesses have the power to progress in incredible ways. Whether we’re supporting our customers’ financial confidence to move ahead, taking commerce to new heights, or encouraging people to explore the world, our colleagues are constantly redefining what’s possible — and we’re proud to back each other every step of the way. When you join #TeamAmex, you become part of a diverse community of over 60,000 colleagues, all with a common goal to deliver an exceptional customer experience every day. 

In building leading edge real-time processing platforms, you will be transforming our iconic, global brand. As a part of our technology team, you will collaborate to bring ground-breaking and diverse ideas to life that power the digital systems, services, products, and platforms upon which millions of customers around the world depend. If you love to build real-time solutions that empower customers and use the latest technologies, we’ll support you with an open environment and learning culture to grow your career.

Focus:
Architect, design, develop, solve problems, debug, evaluate, modify, deploy, and document a real-time / stream processing platform and systems that meet the needs of customer-facing applications, business applications, and/or internal end user applications.
  Organizational Context:
A member of a product engineering team reporting to an Engineering Director.
  How will you make an impact in this role?
Software Development 
Design and build a real-time streaming and complex event processing platform
Build highly performant APIs
Function as member of an agile team by contributing to software builds through consistent design and development practices (tools, common components, and documentation)
Conduct code reviews and automated testing
Debug software components and identify code defects for remediation
Enable the deployment, support, and monitoring of software across development, test, integration, and production environments
Automate deployments
Automatically scale applications based upon demand

Leadership 
Demonstrate self-reliance to achieve team goals
Influence and lead peers with creative changes and improvements by challenging the status quo and demonstrating calculated risk taking
Own and drive designs and solutions even in the presence of ambiguity
Mentor other engineers
Present architecture, designs, and solutions to both technical and non-technical audiences
  As part of our diverse tech team, you can architect, code and ship software that makes us an essential part of our customers’ digital lives. Here, you can work alongside talented engineers in an open, supportive, inclusive environment where your voice is valued, and you make your own decisions on what tech to use to solve challenging problems. Amex offers a range of opportunities to work with the latest technologies and encourages you to back the broader engineering community through open source. And because we understand the importance of keeping your skills fresh and relevant, we give you dedicated time to invest in your professional development. Find your place in technology on #TeamAmex.
  At least 6 years of software development experience in a professional environment and/or comparable experience such as:
Expertise in Java and / or Scala including the latest and advanced features
Experience designing both macro and micro platform / system architecture
Proficiency building solutions with streaming technologies such as Cloud Dataflow or Flink
Experience building highly performant and efficient web APIs preferably using non-blocking frameworks such as Spring WebFlux
Ability to setup Continuous Integration (CI) / Continuous Delivery (CD) pipelines using Git and Jenkins
Ability to containerize applications using Docker
Experience designing, building, and deploying processing as cloud native solutions
Expertise in implementing highly available, fault-tolerant, scalable solutions
Ability to participate in and lead the prevention, diagnosis, and resolution of system outages as an authority in the underlying solution
Proficiency with data structure libraries
Experience with Agile or other rapid application development methods
Strong focus on writing automated tests for your own code
Ability to perform benchmarking and optimization
Bachelor’s Degree in computer science, computer science engineering, or related experience required; advanced degree preferred 
High Performance Behaviors:
Recognizes opportunities to adopt innovative technologies to enable business capabilities
Keeps up to date on current research and technology in the industry
Recognizes the importance of collaboration to achieve objectives
Clearly communicates ideas and concepts to others
Finds opportunities within projects and acts on own initiative without being prompted, including making appropriate decisions
Provides feedback to team members in design and code reviews
Drives creative changes & continuous improvements
Mentors and guides team members to success within the team
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in the English language
Salary Range: $110,000.00 to $190,000.00 annually + bonus + benefits
The above represents the expected salary range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we'll consider your location, experience, and other job-related factors.

title: Manager-Data Science
description:
At American Express, we know that with the right backing, people and businesses have the power to progress in incredible ways. Whether we’re supporting our customers’ financial confidence to move ahead, taking commerce to new heights, or encouraging people to explore the world, our colleagues are constantly redefining what’s possible — and we’re proud to back each other every step of the way.
When you join Team Amex, you become part of a diverse community of over 60,000 colleagues, all with a common goal to deliver an exceptional customer experience every day. Here, you’ll learn and grow as we champion your meaningful career journey with programs, benefits, and flexibility to back you personally and professionally. Every colleague share in the company’s success.
Together, we’ll win as a team, striving to uphold our company values and powerful backing promise to our customers, communities, and each other every day. And we’ll do it with integrity and in an environment where everyone is seen, heard and feels like they truly belong.
Join #TeamAmex and let’s lead the way together.
How we serve our customers is constantly evolving and is a challenge we gladly accept. Whether you’re finding new ways to prevent identity fraud or enabling customers to start a new business, you can work with one of the most valuable data sets in the world to identify insights and actions that can have a meaningful impact on our customers and our business. And, with opportunities to learn from leaders who have defined the course of our industry, you can grow your career and define your own path. Find your place in risk and analytics on #TeamAmex.
How will you make an impact in this role?
The Model Risk Management Group (MRMG) is responsible for oversight of model risk and governance over machine learning usage enterprise wide. The role will be primarily responsible for the review of Finance/ Treasury/ Anti-Money Laundering and Climate Risk models. The responsibilities of the individual are also to ensure that there is an elevation of modeling as well as fulfilling regulatory requirements for model risk management (SR 11-7). This is a highly competitive role and one that ensures the individual achieves maximum potential intellectually as well as for the company.
This role will report to a director in MRMG. The specific responsibilities include:
- Oversee Finance/ Treasury/ Anti-Money Laundering and Climate Risk models which include evaluating conceptual soundness, data quality, performance validation, and on-going monitoring
- Document detailed model review reports and prepare for regulatory and internal audit reviews
- Communicate model review results to business partners, senior leaders, and regulators
- Evaluate machine learning algorithms and their application on models
- Enhance governance framework to accommodate the evolving modeling techniques, model development, as well as model risk management
Qualifications
- Advanced degree in quantitative fields
- Hands-on modeling experience is preferred
- The qualified candidate should have a good understanding of machine learning algorithms (e.g., gradient boosting machine, XGBoost, neural network), artificial intelligence, deep learning as well as classic statistical modeling techniques and assumptions.
- Experience in large data processing and handling is a plus—familiarity with big data platforms and applications, such as Hadoop, Pig, Hive, Spark, AWS.
- Must be skilled in coding using SAS and/or Python/R; additionally, Java, Scala, and C++ a plus
- Strong communication and written skills
- Flexibility and adaptability to work within tight deadlines and changing priorities
Salary Range: $90,000.00 to $165,000.00 annually + bonus + benefits
The above represents the expected salary range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we'll consider your location, experience, and other job-related factors.
American Express is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran status, disability status, age, or any other status protected by law.
We back our colleagues with the support they need to thrive, professionally and personally. That's why we have Amex Flex, our enterprise working model that provides greater flexibility to colleagues while ensuring we preserve the important aspects of our unique in-person culture. Depending on role and business needs, colleagues will either work onsite, in a hybrid model (combination of in-office and virtual days) or fully virtually.
