title: Data Engineer
description:
At American Express, we know that with the right backing, people and businesses have the power to progress in incredible ways. Whether we’re supporting our customers’ financial confidence to move ahead, taking commerce to new heights, or encouraging people to explore the world, our colleagues are constantly redefining what’s possible — and we’re proud to back each other every step of the way. 
When you join Team Amex, you become part of a diverse community of over 60,000 colleagues, all with a common goal to deliver an exceptional customer experience every day. Here, you’ll learn and grow as we champion your meaningful career journey with programs, benefits, and flexibility to back you personally and professionally. Every colleague shares in the company’s success.
Together, we’ll win as a team, striving to uphold our company values and powerful backing promise to our customers, communities, and each other every day.  And, we’ll do it with integrity and in an environment where everyone is seen, heard and feels like they truly belong.
Join #TeamAmex and let’s lead the way together.
As part of our diverse tech team, you can architect, code and ship software that makes us an essential part of our customers’ digital lives. Here, you can work alongside talented engineers in an open, supportive, inclusive environment where your voice is valued, and you make your own decisions on what tech to use to solve challenging problems. Amex offers a range of opportunities to work with the latest technologies and encourages you to back the broader engineering community through open source. And because we understand the importance of keeping your skills fresh and relevant, we give you dedicated time to invest in your professional development. Find your place in technology on #TeamAmex.
As a Data Engineer, you will be a responsible to build core features and functions of card transaction systems on distributed platform deployed in hybrid cloud. Senior Engineer in American Express is an individual contributor role reporting to Director of Engineering.
Responsibilities
You will be responsible to design and build distributed data processing and analytical systems.
Build high level design as well as detailed design of subsystems/features with emphasis on performant code.
Build and code features, working with developers in day-to-day activities and helping in code and other SDLC tasks.
Build POCs to validate new concepts and new technologies.
You will constantly purse and learn industry leading/innovative technologies and solutions. Be acutely aware of enabling technologies and open-source products to build low latency distributed systems.
Lead a culture of innovation and experimentation, engage in fun and outcome-oriented culture, and always be ready to try new concepts without fear of failure.
Collaborate with peer technology and development teams across different locations.
Qualifications
1+ years of work experience in software design and implementation using Java or Scala.
Experience in data processing using Spark.
Knowledge in designing, implementing, and operating any of the NoSQL databases such as Cassandra, Elasticsearch.
 Preferred Qualifications
Experience in distributed data processing and analyzing using Cassandra, Elasticsearch, Spark.
Experience in distributed messaging system such as Kafka
Experience in building Micro services and Service Mesh is a plus
Experience in cloud platforms like Docker, Kubernetes, OpenShift are a plus.
Experience in Continuous integration, Continuous delivery, and DevOps Systems.
Experience in architecting large scale distributed data systems considering scalability, reliability, security, performance, and flexibility.
Clear understanding of various design patterns, threading and memory models supported by the language/VM.
Able to mentor and provide technical guidance to other engineers.
Have excellent written and verbal communications skills. Create and deliver effective presentations to Senior Leadership.
Salary Range: $70,000.00 to $135,000.00 annually + bonus + benefits
The above represents the expected salary range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we'll consider your location, experience, and other job-related factors.
American Express is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran status, disability status, age, or any other status protected by law.
We back our colleagues with the support they need to thrive, professionally and personally. That's why we have Amex Flex, our enterprise working model that provides greater flexibility to colleagues while ensuring we preserve the important aspects of our unique in-person culture. Depending on role and business needs, colleagues will either work onsite, in a hybrid model (combination of in-office and virtual days) or fully virtually.

title: Engineer - Java
description:
You Lead the Way. We’ve Got Your Back.
At American Express, we know that with the right backing, people and businesses have the power to progress in incredible ways. Whether we’re supporting our customers’ financial confidence to move ahead, taking commerce to new heights, or encouraging people to explore the world, our colleagues are constantly redefining what’s possible — and we’re proud to back each other every step of the way. When you join #TeamAmex, you become part of a diverse community of over 60,000 colleagues, all with a common goal to deliver an exceptional customer experience every day.
From building next-generation apps and microservices in Java to using Spring Framework, you could be doing transformational work that brings our iconic, global brand into the future. As a part of our tech team, we could work together to bring ground-breaking and diverse ideas to life that power the digital systems, services, products and platforms that millions of customers around the world depend on. If you love to work with APIs, contribute to open source, or use the latest technologies, we’ll support you with an open environment and learning culture to grow your career.
 
Focus:
Contributes to design, development, troubleshooting, debugging, evaluating, modifying, deploying, and documenting software and systems that meet the needs of customer-facing applications, business applications, and/or internal end user applications.
Organizational Context:
This role of an Engineer will be an integral part of a team that designs and builds large-scale, cloud-native applications and drive us closer to the vision of a robust platform. As a Software Engineer, you wil function as a member of an agile team and helps drive consistent development and test practices with respect to tools, common components, and documentation.
How will you make an impact in this role?
Have primary focus (80%+) on writing quality code, perform unit testing, test automation, quality assurance & automation testing in ongoing sprints.
Build new web services that help manage our rapidly growing capabilities.
Improve efficiency, reliability, and scalability of our data pipelines.
Work on cross-functional initiatives and collaborate with Engineers across organizations.
Build automation for application changes and deployment for faster time to market.
Develops deep understanding of tie-ins with other systems and platforms within the supported domains.
Perform ongoing refactoring of code, quality assurance and testing, applying best practice methodologies and processes.
Identify opportunities to adopt innovative technologies & ideas in development / test area.
Provide continuous support for ongoing application availability.
Collaborate/influence within and across teams to create successes with an innovative mindset and challenge the status quo.
Range of Impact/Influence:
Become a core member of an agile team that designs and develops enterprise class software applications.
Write clean and concise code that is well-tested, easy to maintain, and consistent with existing patterns in our codebase.
Translate user stories and business designs into functioning applications.
Developing and integrating REST APIs between back-end systems to support a high-volume web application.
Collaborating with product owners, delivery managers, and other developers to deliver a quality product.
Taking ownership and responsibility of the work at hand and shepherding code through to production.
Actively pair-programming with teammates for collective code ownership.
You won’t just shape the world of software. You’ll shape the world of life, work and play.   Our Software Engineers not only understand how technology works, but how that technology intersects with the people who count on it every day. Today, innovative ideas, insight and new perspectives are at the core of how we create a more powerful, personal and fulfilling experience for all our customers. So if you’re interested in a career creating breakthrough software and making an impact on an audience of millions, look no further.   You won’t just keep up, you’ll break new ground.    There are hundreds of opportunities to make your mark on technology and life at American Express. 
As part of our diverse tech team, you can architect, code and ship software that makes us an essential part of our customers’ digital lives. Here, you can work alongside talented engineers in an open, supportive, inclusive environment where your voice is valued, and you make your own decisions on what tech to use to solve challenging problems. Amex offers a range of opportunities to work with the latest technologies and encourages you to back the broader engineering community through open source. And because we understand the importance of keeping your skills fresh and relevant, we give you dedicated time to invest in your professional development. Find your place in technology on #TeamAmex.
Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Information Systems, or other related field (or has equivalent work experience):
4+ years of experience in software development.
3+ years of experience in building large scale distributed applications.
3+ years using the Java programming language and the Spring framework.
Knowledge of unit tests using JUnit and Mockito or any other mock framework is also required.
Proficiency in any Object Relational Mapping tool, as a preference Spring Data or Hibernate.
Experience with REST API development on enterprise platforms.
Good knowledge of relational database technologies.
Experience with a build automation tool like Maven or Gradle.
Passion for code quality and continuous improvement of the software.
 We back our colleagues with the support they need to thrive, professionally and personally. That’s why we have Amex Flex, our enterprise working model that provides greater flexibility to colleagues while ensuring we preserve the important aspects of our unique in-person culture. Depending on role and business needs, colleagues will either work onsite, in a hybrid model (combination of in-office and virtual days) or fully virtually.
Employment eligibility to work with American Express in the U.S. is required as the company will not pursue visa sponsorship for these positions.
American Express is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, age, or any other status protected by law.
 Salary Range: $70,000.00 to $135,000.00 annually + bonus + benefits
The above represents the expected salary range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we'll consider your location, experience, and other job-related factors.
American Express is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran status, disability status, age, or any other status protected by law.
We back our colleagues with the support they need to thrive, professionally and personally. That's why we have Amex Flex, our enterprise working model that provides greater flexibility to colleagues while ensuring we preserve the important aspects of our unique in-person culture. Depending on role and business needs, colleagues will either work onsite, in a hybrid model (combination of in-office and virtual days) or fully virtually.

title: Mobile Engineer - Swift / Java / Kotlin
description:
At American Express, we know that with the right backing, people and businesses have the power to progress in incredible ways. Whether we’re supporting our customers’ financial confidence to move ahead, taking commerce to new heights, or encouraging people to explore the world, our colleagues are constantly redefining what’s possible — and we’re proud to back each other every step of the way. 
When you join Team Amex, you become part of a diverse community of over 60,000 colleagues, all with a common goal to deliver an exceptional customer experience every day. Here, you’ll learn and grow as we champion your meaningful career journey with programs, benefits, and flexibility to back you personally and professionally. Every colleague shares in the company’s success.
Together, we’ll win as a team, striving to uphold our company values and powerful backing promise to our customers, communities, and each other every day.  And, we’ll do it with integrity and in an environment where everyone is seen, heard and feels like they truly belong.
Join #TeamAmex and let’s lead the way together.
  As part of our diverse tech team, you can architect, code and ship software that makes us an essential part of our customers’ digital lives. Here, you can work alongside talented engineers in an open, supportive, inclusive environment where your voice is valued, and you make your own decisions on what tech to use to solve challenging problems. Amex offers a range of opportunities to work with the latest technologies and encourages you to back the broader engineering community through open source. And because we understand the importance of keeping your skills fresh and relevant, we give you dedicated time to invest in your professional development. Find your place in technology on #TeamAmex.
The award-winning Mobile team (#1 in JD Power 2021 Mobile App survey) is responsible for the delivery of new features and capabilities in the Amex Mobile App, used by tens of millions of Amex cardholders across 22 markets globally. The team builds interactive experiences at all touch points of a consumer's journey whether before, at, or after the time of purchase. Our mission statement is to be essential in our card members’ digital lives by providing convenience, value, and delight wherever they are.
 You’ll be working in a fast-paced environment with the stability of working for a Fortune 100 company. Your primary responsibilities will be to work on a small team of engineers developing mobile products. You should be familiar with modern software development methodologies and be able to dive deep and rapidly iterate on ideas despite ambiguity.
  You won’t just keep up, you’ll break new ground. 
There are hundreds of opportunities to make your mark on technology and life at American Express. Here’s just some of what you’ll be doing: 
Taking your place as a core member of an agile team driving the latest development practices
Writing code and unit tests, working with API specs and automation
Identifying opportunities for adopting new technologies
Join a team of engineers that delivers knowledge management solutions to businesses worldwide
At the core of Software Engineering
Every member of our team must be able to demonstrate the following technical, functional, leadership and business core competencies, including: 
Agile Practices
Porting/Software Configuration
Programming Languages and Frameworks
Business Analysis
Analytical Thinking
Business Product Knowledge 
  Responsibilities
Contribute to the design, architecture, and development of apps that are elegant, efficient, secure, highly available, and maintainable
Works closely with other developers and end users to ensure technical compatibility and user satisfaction
Contribute insights into ways to improve our processes and tools
Be highly motivated and maintain a positive, “can-do” attitude in a fast-moving environment
Follow and help cultivate consistent development best practices
Collaborates with project manager and other software developers to plan, design, develop, test, and maintain the application
Provides thought-leadership regarding implementation best practices
Assists in estimation and assessment of feasibility of features
Foster a collaborative spirit across multiple teams
Minimum Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science/Engineering/Mathematics or 1+ years of equivalent experience in related disciplines
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills
Knowledge of developing trends and emerging standards in mobile apps, mobile payments, and wearables
Minimum of 1 year of experience in Mobile Development with IOS / Android and experience in Software Development
Good understanding of RESTful APIs and how to connect applications to back-end services using asynchronous network calls
Experience with Swift and/or Functional Programming.
Experience with Java and/or Kotlin (optional)
Knowledge of developing trends and emerging standards in mobile apps, mobile payments, and wearables
Preferred Qualifications
Experience with the following patterns/technologies: MVVM Architecture
Auto layout
RAML API Documentation
Experience with Unit, UI and Integration testing using XCTest/XCUITest
Apps Published in the App Store
GHC  SHPE SWE SHPE Afrotech
American Express is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran status, disability status, age, or any other status protected by law.
We back our colleagues with the support they need to thrive, professionally and personally. That's why we have Amex Flex, our enterprise working model that provides greater flexibility to colleagues while ensuring we preserve the important aspects of our unique in-person culture. Depending on role and business needs, colleagues will either work onsite, in a hybrid model (combination of in-office and virtual days) or fully virtually.
If the role you are applying for is designated as hybrid or onsite, you will be required to demonstrate that you have completed your primary COVID-19 vaccination series (i.e. 2 doses for Moderna/Pfizer and 1 dose for J&J), in order to work in or visit any of our offices. This requirement is subject to legally required accommodations.

title: Associate Digital Product Management
description:
You Lead the Way. We’ve Got Your Back.
At American Express, we know that with the right backing, people and businesses have the power to progress in incredible ways. Whether we’re supporting our customers’ financial confidence to move ahead, taking commerce to new heights, or encouraging people to explore the world, our colleagues are constantly redefining what’s possible - and we’re proud to back each other every step of the way. When you join #TeamAmex, you become part of a diverse community of over 60,000 colleagues, all with a common goal to deliver an exceptional customer experience every day.
The Enterprise Digital & Data Solutions (EDDS) BU is responsible for the product management and design of American Express’ proprietary digital platforms. As a team we are focused on driving engagement, satisfaction, and revenue through a combination of best-in-class user experience and compelling features and functionality.
As one of the enterprise teams within American Express, Enterprise Digital & Data Solutions (EDDS) works closely with colleagues across the Blue-Box to drive growth, margin expansion and marketplace differentiation to accelerate our digital strategy forward.
We’re looking for a talented and passionate Associate Product Manager– Product Development to join our team. The successful candidate will have experience managing digital initiatives and will support the Product Owners in the ideation and development of mobile products and services. If you are interested in working on customer experience, mobile product development, and strategy, we’d love to hear from you.
Required
BS or MS degree in computer science, computer engineering, or other similar background, with 3-6 years of work experience
Understanding of building relationships and working with others
Experience of delivering and making things happen
Be highly motivated and maintain a positive, “can-do” attitude in a fast paced environment
An ability to deal with a fast pace and changing needs
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Has enthusiasm and passion for extraordinary products and services. Employs story telling to articulate product vision.
Curious about the why and how
Preferred
Understanding of basic Agile principles and/or experience in Agile Product Development
Experience using qualitative and quantitative data to drive backlog improvements
Familiarity with basic UX/UI principles
Experience in matrix organizations and cross-functional environments
Analytical attitude and experience making data driven decisions
Additional Considerations
Agile practices and experience with tools like(JIRA, Rally, Mural, Invision, etc.)
   American Express is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran status, disability status, age, or any other status protected by law.

At American Express, we know that with the right backing, people and businesses have the power to progress in incredible ways. Whether we’re supporting our customers’ financial confidence to move ahead, taking commerce to new heights, or encouraging people to explore the world, our colleagues are constantly redefining what’s possible— and we’re proud to back each other every step of the way.
Join #TeamAmex and let’s lead the way together.
  The core of our company is not just the products we offer, but the personal connections our customers have with our brand. You can create digital experiences– from payments to rewards to servicing– that keep us connected to our customers and serve them at every touchpoint. From digital servicing and lifestyle features to secure, frictionless payment options, you can make a meaningful difference in our customers’ lives and help set us apart in the industry.
  Business Unit/Role Specific Info
Enterprise Digital & Data Solutions
  Enterprise Digital & Data Solutions (EDDS) develops and scales high-impact, mobile-centric and personalized digital experiences, powered by data & analytics, throughout the customer lifecycle. EDDS Operational Excellence enables profitable business growth and exceptional customer experiences driving excellence, speed and agility across products, platforms, processes and capabilities. Through the design and implementation of an effective framework, the EDDS Operational Excellence Team will ensure the EDDS organization is fulfilling on its obligations to customers and has a robust control environment operating in compliance with evolving global regulations.

In line with Amex’s “three lines of defense” approach to risk management, the Operational Excellence team  (First Line of Defense) actively works with Second Line of Defense (Global Risk, Compliance, Privacy) and Third Line of Defense (Internal Audit) teams to ensure adequate implementation of risk management framework requirements.

The Intern, EDDS Operational Excellence, will join us in Summer 2023 and become part of a high performing team to deliver on the EDDS Operational Excellence vision and objectives. Under the Director, EDDS Operational Excellence, the intern will assist first line of defense operational risk activities for Digital and Data initiatives.
  The Intern, EDDS Operational Excellence will be responsible for:
Develop and lead a business case to enable better efficiencies within the Operational Excellence team.
Actively engage in discussions with key stakeholders to assess strong points and areas of opportunity.
Collaborate with colleagues to understand and assess our current engagement model.
Identify trends, themes, tendencies that indicate emerging operational risks by analyzing data and trends in relevant metrics, loss event data and external events.
  At the end of the program, the intern’s business case will play an influential role in designing the next iteration of our team’s engagement model.
Offer of employment with American Express is conditioned upon the successful completion of a background verification check, subject to applicable laws and regulations.
Minimum Qualifications 
Strong interest in Banking, Risk Management, Compliance or Regulatory.
Actively pursuing a degree in Business, Business Management, Finance, Economics or Data Analytics.
Ability to learn quickly, “connect the dots” with a strong track record of developing ideas from concept to deployment and delivering win-win solutions for the business
Process oriented with strong organizational, project management and multi-tasking skills.
Exceptional verbal and written communication skills, alongside excellent analytical skills
Independent, self-motivated, with an ability to adapt and be flexible in a team environment
Creative and highly collaborative approach to solving business problems
Ability to challenge the status quo
Microsoft Suite Proficiency (Word, PowerPoint, Excel, Outlook)
    Our team will review completed applications on a rolling basis. We appreciate your patience while we consider your application and will be in contact with you by November 30th.
Employment eligibility to work with American Express in the U.S. is required as the company will not pursue visa sponsorship for these positions.

title: Sr Analyst – Paid Media
description:
You Lead the Way. We’ve Got Your Back.
At American Express, we know that with the right backing, people and businesses have the power to progress in incredible ways. Whether we’re supporting our customers’ financial confidence to move ahead, taking commerce to new heights, or encouraging people to explore the world, our colleagues are constantly redefining what’s possible — and we’re proud to back each other every step of the way. When you join #TeamAmex, you become part of a diverse community of over 60,000 colleagues, all with a common goal to deliver an exceptional customer experience every day.
  We back our colleagues with the support they need to thrive, professionally and personally. That’s why we have Amex Flex, our enterprise working model that provides greater flexibility to colleagues while ensuring we preserve the important aspects of our unique in-person culture. Depending on role and business needs, colleagues will either work onsite, in a hybrid model (combination of in-office and virtual days) or fully virtually.
  The New Member Acquisition team is a fast-paced organization and a significant driver of new Consumer Card Members into the American Express franchise. The team is dedicated to delivering best-in-class digital marketing and card acquisition experiences with the goal of growing new accounts and spend acquired. The Digital Demand Generation Team is dedicated to delivering best in class digital marketing and card shopping experiences through distribution partnerships and offsite marketing channels.
  The Senior Analyst, Paid Media will be responsible for leading execution of key Paid Digital Media marketing initiatives to drive efficient prospect acquisition at scale.
  This is a great opportunity for candidates who want to strengthen their digital marketing skills and gain external partner management experience. It provides a chance to be at the forefront of digital growth & innovation, working with a collaborative team and building strong external partnerships.
  Key Responsibilities: 
Lead agency partners in the development and execution of new programmatic media advertising that directly connects to key business initiatives, including new product launches, limited time offers, new benefits, and more; oversee the end-to-end process from concept to launch
Partner with external agency and internal marketing, strategy, and analytics teams to identify targeting opportunities, develop strategic channel recommendations, and ensure deliverables are optimally executed
Lead channel-level creative development and offer strategy execution
Own channel budget forecasting & reconciliation; drive efficiencies in process
Partner closely with analytics teams to build analytical narratives on channel performance and recommend channel optimizations and strategic pivots
Serve as a subject matter expert for acquisition Paid Media across the organization; share out on test & learn results, creative best practices, and highly relevant industry trends
  Minimum Qualifications:
Strong analytical skills with a proficiency in Excel
Meticulous attention to detail
Ability to quickly shift priorities based on changes in internal or external landscape
Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously
Self-starter with an ability to navigate the organization and processes independently
Demonstrated ability to develop strong relationships and influence partners to get results
Energetic, positive, self-motivated, and proactive
Great communicator with a passion for creative problem-solving
Experience in digital marketing and agency management a plus
Understanding of programmatic media and 3rd Party tracking a plus
Experience in highly regulated industry a plus
Bachelor's Degree
  Salary Range: $55,000.00 to $105,000.00 annually + bonus + benefits
The above represents the expected salary range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we'll consider your location, experience, and other job-related factors.

title: Senior Java Software Engineer - Digital Banking
description:
At American Express, we know that with the right backing, people and businesses have the power to progress in incredible ways. Whether we’re supporting our customers’ financial confidence to move ahead, taking commerce to new heights, or encouraging people to explore the world, our colleagues are constantly redefining what’s possible — and we’re proud to back each other every step of the way.
When you join Team Amex, you become part of a diverse community of over 60,000 colleagues, all with a common goal to deliver an exceptional customer experience every day. Here, you’ll learn and grow as we champion your meaningful career journey with programs, benefits, and flexibility to back you personally and professionally. Every colleague shares in the company’s success.
Together, we’ll win as a team, striving to uphold our company values and powerful backing promise to our customers, communities, and each other every day. And, we’ll do it with integrity and in an environment where everyone is seen, heard and feels like they truly belong.
Join #TeamAmex and let’s lead the way together.
  We’re looking for an experienced Java Backend Engineer to join a top talent team working on a fast-evolving set of experimental and new applications, services and platforms that is serving tens of millions of customers around the world. Someone who is passionate about shaping the future of commerce and personal finance; Dedicated to good design and great code; Someone who can find elegant solutions to hard technical and functional challenges and can work well within and across teams.
  Responsibilities
Serve as a member of an agile development team that drives user story analysis and elaboration.
Design and develop software solutions, think abstractly and deal with ambiguous/under-defined problems.
Foster the spirit of collaboration across multiple internal teams.
Actively participate in team and architecture and engineering discussions
Participate in code reviews, ad-hoc pair programming; contribute to iterative improvement of tools, automation and practices used by team.
Mentor and lead team members.
  As part of our diverse tech team, you can architect, code and ship software that makes us an essential part of our customers’ digital lives. Here, you can work alongside passionate engineers in an open, supportive, inclusive environment where your voice is valued, and you make your own decisions on what tech to use to solve complicated problems.
Proven expertise in REST API design and implementation.
Proven expertise in with SOA, Micro-Services, Containers.
Experience with Stream processing/Queue - Solace, Kafka.
Experience with Databases - Couchbase (Or a different Document DB/ NoSQL), PostgreSQL.
Familiar with tools - Git, Jenkins, IntelliJ IDEA, Jira, Confluence.
Familiarity with security principles, SSL, Cryptography.
7+ Years of experience with Java backend (J2EE).
2+ Years Reactive Programing (asynchronous programming paradigm) ideally with Vertx and RxJava.
A BS or MS degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or similar discipline, or equivalent work experience
Experience building and supporting distributed highly available systems.
Good communication skills.
High energy and ‘can-do’ attitude.
Interest in new technologies and tools, industry best practices.
Passion for shipping quality software fast and frequently.
Attention to detail.
As part of our diverse tech team, you can architect, code and ship software that makes usan essential part of our customers’ digital lives. Here, you can work alongside talented
engineers in an open, supportive, inclusive environment where your voice is valued, and
you make your own decisions on what tech to use to solve challenging problems. Amex
offers a range of opportunities to work with the latest technologies and encourages you
to back the broader engineering community through open source. And because we
understand the importance of keeping your skills fresh and relevant, we give you
dedicated time to invest in your professional development. Find your place in technology
on #TeamAmex.

title: Senior Manager - Product Development
description:
Corporate Onboarding is one of American Express’ top enterprise initiatives and a core component is creating seamless user experiences to serve a wide range of Corporate Client structures. The purpose of the Onboarding Capabilities team is to modernize the onboarding process globally by leading with a product mindset to develop robust capabilities that support the customer journey and scale the growing Corporate business. The Onboarding Capabilities team is a fast-paced & innovative team that partners with a cross functional set of stakeholders including Sales, Marketing, Risk, Product, Compliance and Tech partners across the globe to modernize the onboarding experience.
  We are looking for a seasoned Product Manager to help steer the direction of modernizing corporate onboarding and to lead a team of enthusiastic product owners. We have a tremendous opportunity to reinvent and refocus the onboarding roadmap to support best-in-class capabilities, define future state functionalities and much more to deliver delightful and seamless experience for our customers and partners.
  We are looking for a high-caliber individual who will be responsible for leading a team of product owners while driving the focus in the product roadmap across competing initiatives and timelines. This position is high visibility and intensely collaborative with product owners and managers, engineers, designers, and possibly external vendors to drive a strategic vision, prioritization, and a customer first mindset. A successful candidate will be focused, collaborative, strategic and able to articulate a product strategy into prioritization in a continuous delivery model.
  Job Responsibilities:
Lead a team of product owners across all capability types focused on supporting their day to day and shaping their career growth
Collaborate across multiple teams in high pressure situations to drive alignment, clarity, and support
Define and manage the product strategy against competing priorities across teams with varying timelines
Communicate clearly and candidly to senior leadership as the intersection point of multiple initiatives
Support a culture of a customer first mindset by driving creative solutions, collaboration across multiple teams, and speaking up for the customer to bring scale to the global landscape
Develop a healthy product pipeline of optimizations that create a wide impact and encourage speed to market
Spearhead the coordination of multiple project intersections to ensure the team has a clear focus without distraction
  Required Skills/Qualifications:
Bachelor’s Degree required
4+ years of digital product development experience
Previous experience with basic UX/UI principles
Understanding of Agile principles and experience working in Scrum
Ability to work with and analyze complex inputs, extracting key themes and messages to drive decisions
Highly organized, detail oriented with a proven ability to manage multiple workflows
Able to effectively adapt under changing conditions and prioritize initiatives in a fast-paced environment
Experience running discovery on complex problems within matrixed organizations
Strong relationship management and problem-solving skills
Strong written and verbal communication skills
  Preferred Additional Skills/Qualifications:
Driven, curious and diligent problem solver with a willingness to learn, challenge the status quo and collaborate to make an impact
Experience with people management is a plus
Previous experience in a compliance or regulatory environment
Experience on a global team
Experience in matrix organizations and cross-functional environments
Experience with JIRA, Confluence, Rally, Adobe Omniture, Tableau, and Invision a strong plus
  Salary Range: $90,000.00 to $165,000.00 annually + sales incentive + equity (if applicable) + benefits
  The above represents the expected salary range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we'll consider your location, experience, and other job-related factors.
  American Express is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran status, disability status, age, or any other status protected by law.
  Employment eligibility to work with American Express in the U.S. is required as the company will not pursue visa sponsorship for these positions. 
  We back our colleagues with the support they need to thrive, professionally and personally. That's why we have Amex Flex, our enterprise working model that provides greater flexibility to colleagues while ensuring we preserve the important aspects of our unique in-person culture. Depending on role and business needs, colleagues will either work onsite, in a hybrid model (combination of in-office and virtual days) or fully virtually.

title: Senior Manager-Risk Management
description:
You Lead the Way. We’ve Got Your Back.
  With the right backing, people and businesses have the power to progress in incredible ways. When you join Team Amex, you become part of a global and diverse community of colleagues with an unwavering commitment to back our customers, communities and each other. Here, you’ll learn and grow as we help you create a career journey that’s unique and meaningful to you with benefits, programs, and flexibility that support you personally and professionally.
  At American Express, you’ll be recognized for your contributions, leadership, and impact—every colleague has the opportunity to share in the company’s success. Together, we’ll win as a team, striving to uphold our company values and powerful backing promise to provide the world’s best customer experience every day. And we’ll do it with the utmost integrity, and in an environment where everyone is seen, heard and feels like they belong.
  Join #TeamAmex and let's lead the way together.
  Description:
The Operational Excellence team is the First Line of Defense (FLoD) team with a mission to enable business growth and objectives while maintaining a strong control environment. The team acts as a Center of Excellence (CoE) within the business, and assists in the identification, assessment, monitoring, and management of Operational Risks related to the business products, processes, and initiatives. Operational risk is the risk to the current or projected business objectives and resilience arising from inadequate or failed internal processes or systems, human errors or misconduct, or adverse external events.
  This team’s scope includes all aspects of GABM (Global Advertising and Brand Management), including Brand Management, media buying, sponsorships and experiences, enterprise marketing strategy and Amex Insights.For these areas of the business, the Operational Excellence team leads governance and implementation of requirements related to several large-scale programs like New Initiatives, PRSA Controls and Testing, Third Party Risk, IAG/Regulatory Exams, Information Security, Privacy, Financial Reporting, Physical Security and Business Continuity/Resiliency.
  In line with Amex’s “three lines of defense” approach to risk management, the FLoD Operational Excellence team actively works with Second Line of Defense (GRBC, Compliance, Privacy) and Third Line of Defense (Internal Audit) teams to ensure adequate implementation of risk management framework requirements.
  Job Requirements:
The Manager/Sr. Manager, Operational Excellence role will be responsible for promoting a strong risk management culture, provide tools and training, and support the Operational Excellence team and GABM partners by leading projects and processes critical to the operations of the team including, but not limited to, tracking risk framework performance, creating and maintaining scorecards, developing ad hoc reporting for senior leadership and, collaborating closely with various risk pillar SMEs and GABM to ensure all activities follow internal standards, policies and regulatory expectations.
  Key activities of the role will include:
Drive a culture of Operational Excellence and Continuous Improvement and ensure the GABM organization is meeting expectations of the Control Rating.
Generate awareness and educate the GABM business on Third Party Governance requirements, due diligence, and standard processes. Build tools and resources to support the above.
Support Regulatory requirements associated with the Third Party Program
Management of large-scale Operational Risk programs like New Initiatives Approval/Assessment (FIG), Third Party Lifecycle Management, Corrective Action/Loss Event Resolution and Process Risk Self-Assessment (PRSA)
Be a trusted advisor for the GABM teams; helping enable successful launch of business initiatives, yet with strong preventative and detective controls
Partner with Compliance and GCO to ensure GABM initiatives and processes follow applicable laws, regulations and policies, with effective controls and detailed testing to prove compliance.
Independently assess operational risks – challenging both our historical practices and working with business partners to improve processes
Identify trends, themes, tendencies that indicate emerging operational risks by analyzing data and trends
Effectively communicate findings to business partners in order to drive necessary responses and action.
Drive pragmatic business decisions on complex customer/shareholder issues
Represent GABM in relevant governance forums, management committees and internal/external reviews.
  Qualifications:
4-7 years of experience in operational risk management, strategy, internal control and process or similar function within Financial Services industries Demonstrated skills in analyzing and synthesizing data and presenting data in a simple, business-focused presentation format.
Strong people leader and great teammate with a demonstrated ability to develop team members and create highly effective and results-driven culture
Must have broad knowledge and experience in all large operational risk management programs like Issue Management, PRSA, New Product Approval and Third-Party Risk and/or Compliance and Regulatory requirements
Relationship management and a proven track record of positively collaborating and partnering with various areas of the business
Highly motivated self-starter, with a sense of urgency, positive attitude and an agile approch- ability to shift priorities with changing internal and external environment
Comfortable working with complex and rapidly changing, technology enabled business processes – with a strong understanding of associated risks, threats and risks of reliance on third parties.
Ability to prioritize high-impact issues, and successfully influence without authority across functions and geographies.
Prior leadership experience in Operational Excellence, Business Operations, Risk Management, Internal Audit, Compliance or related fields, with proven experience in collaborating with management at various levels
Adept at breaking down complex matters into core issues and root causes that can be more readily addressed.
Bachelors or master’s degree in business, MBA preferred
  Salary Range: $90,000.00 to $165,000.00 annually + bonus + benefits
The above represents the expected salary range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we'll consider your location, experience, and other job-related factors.
American Express is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran status, disability status, age, or any other status protected by law.

title: Senior Product Designer
description:
At American Express, we know that with the right backing, people and businesses have the power to progress in incredible ways. Whether we’re supporting our customers’ financial confidence to move ahead, taking commerce to new heights, or encouraging people to explore the world, our colleagues are constantly redefining what’s possible — and we’re proud to back each other every step of the way.
When you join Team Amex, you become part of a diverse community of over 60,000 colleagues, all with a common goal to deliver an exceptional customer experience every day. Here, you’ll learn and grow as we champion your meaningful career journey with programs, benefits, and flexibility to back you personally and professionally. Every colleague shares in the company’s success.
Together, we’ll win as a team, striving to uphold our company values and powerful backing promise to our customers, communities, and each other every day. And, we’ll do it with integrity and in an environment where everyone is seen, heard and feels like they truly belong.
Join #TeamAmex and let’s lead the way together.
There’s a difference between having a job and making a difference.  
  The Enterprise Platforms Sales & Marketing (EPSAM) organization is part of the larger Enterprise Platforms Center of Excellence where product and engineering colleagues have been brought together to drive a step function change in speed to market and further unlock customer value across a number of the company’s core platforms. EPSAM’s global Salesforce.com platform sits at the heart of American Express’ global marketing, sales and account development functions for all lines of business.  In short, this platform is a critical enabler of American Express’ customer centricity and growth objectives. 
  The Senior Product Designer will be responsible for understanding the needs of our Salesforce.com users and translating those needs into product experiences that engage our members and competitively differentiate American Express’ digital experiences.  As a full stack product designer, they will deliver high quality research and design throughout the entire product development lifecycle alongside cross-functional teams.  
  The Senior Product Designer be a key member of the centralized Product Design team supporting EPSAM and will collaborate with product and engineering teams to deliver user research insights, lo-fi concepts through high fidelity prototypes, and UX roadmaps to drive product strategy, products, and features from concept to launch in a fast-paced environment. They will contribute to defining and implementing UX principles and educating the EPSAM organization on design principles. 
  You will: 
Define user research objectives and methodology and conduct research sessions, translating user needs into insights to influence product strategy 
Build detailed wireframes, information architecture diagrams, mental models, personas, usability testing stimulus, site maps, story boards, user flows and high / low fidelity prototypes along with a wide range of UX assets and results 
Interact with users to identify needs, opportunities, gaps, and tackle problems 
Fluently deliver just in time design works for sprint cycles while improving the quality and experience of Salesforce.com products and overall platform 
Lead UX projects through all phases of product development cycle, ship, and iteration 
Facilitate cross-functional collaboration with product and engineering teams, product marketing, and project management to define a product vision and strategy that is aligned with the high-level product roadmap 
Use your analytical abilities and strategic viewpoint to identify trends & recommend solutions that will help improve user experience 
Support reporting activities associated with usability metrics and user satisfaction 
Provide mentorship and guidance and serve as role model to other designers on behavior and practice
As part of our diverse tech team, you can architect, code and ship software that makes usan essential part of our customers’ digital lives. Here, you can work alongside talented
engineers in an open, supportive, inclusive environment where your voice is valued, and
you make your own decisions on what tech to use to solve challenging problems. Amex
offers a range of opportunities to work with the latest technologies and encourages you
to back the broader engineering community through open source. And because we
understand the importance of keeping your skills fresh and relevant, we give you
dedicated time to invest in your professional development. Find your place in technology
on #TeamAmex.
  5+ years of experience in User Experience, Interaction / Product Design 
Strong strategic thought leadership including capacity to quickly understand critical linkages and business strategies 
Strong portfolio showing examples of complex design challenges highlighting your end-to-end design process from concept through delivery and iterative releases 
Ability to simplify and turn complex interactions into intuitive user experiences that align to business goals 
Deep understanding of the various qualitative user experience methods and tools, e.g., usability testing, remote testing, and when to apply them 
Experience with designing user journeys, identifying difficulties, and designing solutions to tackle customer problems 
Proven proficiency in industry standard tools including Sketch, InVision, Abstract, Figma, and virtual whiteboarding like Mural or Miro 
Experience leading workshops on topics such as design thinking, rapid prototyping, and insight/journey mapping 
Experience working in cross-functional, distributed teams in an matrixed environment 
Experience designing for internal or enterprise users, or with Salesforce.com platform design, is preferred 
Degree in computer Science, Interaction Design, Human Computer Interaction or related field, or equivalent preferred 
We back our colleagues with the support they need to thrive, professionally and personally. That’s why we have Amex Flex, our enterprise working model that provides greater flexibility to colleagues while ensuring we preserve the important aspects of our unique in-person culture. Depending on role and business needs, colleagues will either work onsite, in a hybrid model (combination of in-office and virtual days) or fully virtually.

Employment eligibility to work with American Express in the U.S. is required as the company will not pursue visa sponsorship for these positions.
American Express is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, age, or any other status protected by law.
 Salary Range: $90,000.00 to $165,000.00 annually + bonus + benefits
The above represents the expected salary range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we'll consider your location, experience, and other job-related factors.

That's why we have Amex Flex, our enterprise working model that provides greater flexibility to colleagues while ensuring we preserve the important aspects of our unique in-person culture. Depending on role and business needs, colleagues will either work onsite, in a hybrid model (combination of in-office and virtual days) or fully virtually.

title: Software Engineer II
description:
At American Express, we know that with the right backing, people and businesses have the power to progress in incredible ways. Whether we’re supporting our customers’ financial confidence to move ahead, taking commerce to new heights, or encouraging people to explore the world, our colleagues are constantly redefining what’s possible — and we’re proud to back each other every step of the way.
When you join Team Amex, you become part of a diverse community of over 60,000 colleagues, all with a common goal to deliver an exceptional customer experience every day. Here, you’ll learn and grow as we champion your meaningful career journey with programs, benefits, and flexibility to back you personally and professionally. Every colleague share in the company’s success.
Together, we’ll win as a team, striving to uphold our company values and powerful backing promise to our customers, communities, and each other every day. And we’ll do it with integrity and in an environment where everyone is seen, heard and feels like they truly belong.
Join #TeamAmex and let’s lead the way together.
You Lead the Way. We’ve Got Your Back. At American Express, we know that with the right backing, people and businesses have the power to progress in incredible ways. Whether we’re supporting our customers’ financial confidence to move ahead, taking commerce to new heights, or encouraging people to explore the world, our colleagues are constantly redefining what’s possible — and we’re proud to back each other every step of the way. When you join #TeamAmex, you become part of a diverse community of over 60,000 colleagues, all with a common goal to deliver an exceptional customer experience every day.
We’re looking for an experienced Java Backend Engineer to join a top talent team working on a fast-evolving set of experimental and new applications, services and platforms that is serving tens of millions of customers around the world. Someone who is passionate about shaping the future of commerce and personal finance; Dedicated to good design and great code; Someone who can find elegant solutions to hard technical and functional challenges and can work well within and across teams.
Responsibilities
Serve as a member of an agile development team that drives user story analysis and elaboration.
Design and develop software solutions, think abstractly and deal with ambiguous/under-defined problems.
Foster the spirit of collaboration across multiple internal teams.
Actively participate in team and architecture and engineering discussions
Participate in code reviews, ad-hoc pair programming; contribute to iterative improvement of tools, automation and practices used by team.
Mentor and lead team members.
As part of our diverse tech team, you can architect, code and ship software that makes us an essential part of our customers’ digital lives.  Here, you can work alongside talented engineers in an open, supportive, inclusive environment where your voice is valued, and you make your own decisions on what tech to use to solve challenging problems.  American Express offers a range of opportunities to work with the latest technologies and encourages you to back the broader engineering community through open source.  And because we understand the importance of keeping your skills fresh and relevant, we give you dedicated time to invest in your professional development.  Find your place in technology of #TeamAmex.
Salary Range: $85,000.00 to $150,000.00 annually + bonus + benefits
The above represents the expected salary range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we'll consider your location, experience, and other job-related factors.
Qialifications:
Proven expertise in REST API design and implementation.
Proven expertise in with SOA, Micro-Services, Containers.
Experience with Stream processing/Queue - Solace, Kafka.
Experience with Databases - Couchbase (Or a different Document DB/ NoSQL), PostgreSQL.
Familiar with tools - Git, Jenkins, IntelliJ IDEA, Jira, Confluence.
Familiarity with security principles, SSL, Cryptography.
3+ Years of experience with Java backend (J2EE).
2+ Years Reactive Programing (asynchronous programming paradigm) ideally with Vertx and RxJava.
A BS or MS degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or similar discipline, or equivalent work experience
Experience building and supporting distributed highly available systems.
Good communication skills.
High energy and ‘can-do’ attitude.
Interest in new technologies and tools, industry best practices.
Passion for shipping quality software fast and frequently.
Attention to detail.

title: Campus Graduate 2023 Credit & Fraud Risk Product Innovation Summer Internship
description:
About AMEX 
At American Express, we know that with the right backing, people and businesses have the power to progress in incredible ways. Whether we’re supporting our customers’ financial confidence to move ahead, taking commerce to new heights, or encouraging people to explore the world, our colleagues are constantly redefining what’s possible— and we’re proud to back each other every step of the way. 
Join #TeamAmex and let’s lead the way together. 
  The core of our company is not just the products we offer, but the personal connections our customers have with our brand. You can create digital experiences– from payments to rewards to servicing– that keep us connected to our customers and serve them at every touchpoint. From digital servicing and lifestyle features to secure, frictionless payment options, you can make a meaningful difference in our customers’ lives and help set us apart in the industry.  
  Business Unit/Role Specific Info 
Where are these roles located within American Express?  
Risk Products: This team brings risk strategies to life by enabling customer focused capabilities for Card and Non-Card products. You will collaborate with partners in other Risk teams, Marketing, Finance, Global Servicing Network, Legal/Compliance, Banking, and Technologies to build world-class analytical capabilities and solutions to minimize credit and fraud risk and improve customer experience. 
  Skills/Experience  
Proven interest in digital technologies and customer focused design  
Independent thinker who’s organized, has great attention to detail, and can multi-task  
Strong analytical, problem-solving/quantitative skills  
Willing to take risks, experiment, and share fresh perspectives  
Proficient in analytical and presentation tools, including Excel and PowerPoint  
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, and ability to present ideas clearly  
  Requirements/Qualifications  
Currently enrolled in full-time graduate degree program  
Students must have a graduation date between December 2023 and June 2024

title: Manager-Risk Management
description:
You Lead the Way. We’ve Got Your Back.
With the right backing, people and businesses have the power to progress in incredible ways. When you join Team Amex, you become part of a global and diverse community of colleagues with an unwavering commitment to back our customers, communities and each other. Here, you’ll learn and grow as we help you create a career journey that’s unique and meaningful to you with benefits, programs, and flexibility that support you personally and professionally.
At American Express, you’ll be recognized for your contributions, leadership, and impact—every colleague has the opportunity to share in the company’s success. Together, we’ll win as a team, striving to uphold our company values and powerful backing promise to provide the world’s best customer experience every day. And we’ll do it with the utmost integrity, and in an environment where everyone is seen, heard and feels like they belong.
Join Team Amex and let's lead the way together.
To deliver on this vision, Global Commercial Customer Management, along with other partner teams at American Express, is driving the roadmap for modernizing the Authorizations platform, which will uplift an aging infrastructure and provide new capabilities to enable rapid innovation and growth. This is a strategic imperative for American Express and is part of the Top 5 enterprise priorities.
We are looking for a Manager/Senior Manager who will drive the credit risk vision and strategy of this platform for all commercial products globally. This is a high impact and high visibility role. It will not only involve working with a vast set of partner teams within the company, but it will also involve frequent senior leadership updates.

The successful individual will be responsible for architecting the Held Remit journey of the future and to ensure that the new platform design meets the evolving needs of the enterprise.  This role requires someone who has a fundamental grounding in credit strategy and risk systems, but more importantly very strong leadership skills. 
  Minimum Qualifications
Seasoned risk management professional with a sound understanding of various aspects of customer management and an experience in designing credit risk solutions for the enterprise. Experience in managing risk within the commercial portfolios is preferred. 
Strong leadership traits including ability to: define a compelling vision & strategy, communicate with clarity, collaborate with, and influence multiple stakeholders at various band levels and make quick and effective decisions.
Ability to provide structure in ambiguity, excel in a dynamic and complex environment, and deliver under tight deadlines.
Logical and analytical thinking, intellectual curiosity, and an innovative approach to solving business problems
Ability to get into details, and yet be able to step back to take decisions with a long-term enterprise view and customer-first mindset. 
Having the patience and drive to sustain the momentum over a long-term project, while breaking down the journey into near term milestones to demonstrate business impact along the way. Will require a high degree of organizing skills, self-motivation, and personal accountability.
3+ years of people leadership experience with strong followership and a track record of building diverse high performing teams
Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Finance, or a related field with 5 or more years of experience in credit risk management. Advanced degree in a quantitative field and/or MBA with analytical experience preferred
  Salary Range: $80,000.00 to $155,000.00 annually + bonus + benefits

The above represents the expected salary range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we'll consider your location, experience, and other job-related factors.
American Express is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran status, disability status, age, or any other status protected by law.
We back our colleagues with the support they need to thrive, professionally and personally. That's why we have Amex Flex, our enterprise working model that provides greater flexibility to colleagues while ensuring we preserve the important aspects of our unique in-person culture. Depending on role and business needs, colleagues will either work onsite, in a hybrid model (combination of in-office and virtual days) or fully virtually.

title: Campus Graduate - 2023 Global Consumer Services Group Product Summer Internship
description:
About AMEX 
At American Express, we know that with the right backing, people and businesses have the power to progress in incredible ways. Whether we’re supporting our customers’ financial confidence to move ahead, taking commerce to new heights, or encouraging people to explore the world, our colleagues are constantly redefining what’s possible— and we’re proud to back each other every step of the way. 
Join #TeamAmex and let’s lead the way together. 
The core of our Company is not just the products we offer, but the personal connections our customers have with our brand. You can create membership and card member experiences– from credit cards to lending features and membership services – that keep us connected to our customers and serve them at every touchpoint. From the Card Products and lifestyle features you can make a meaningful difference in our customers’ lives and help set us apart in the industry.   
We’re looking for a Graduate level Intern to support the team on critical and innovative projects as a Summer Product Manager. The successful candidate will own a project contributing to either the launch or evolution of our card, lending, or membership (I.e. travel, dining, etc.) services products. This person will contribute to product vision, strategy, and delivery of our digital products and gain invaluable experience as an Associate Product Manager. Product Managers at American Express play a central role identifying customer needs, building outstanding experiences, and leading teams across the company to launch these products. This is a fast-paced team driving the development of card member solutions and partner experiences at American Express.   
  Summer Product Manager Possible Team Placements: Successful candidates will be placed within one of the below business units:    
  Global Consumer Services Group (GCSG) is responsible for growing the American Express consumer business worldwide, strengthening our global leadership position in the premium space, and delivering exceptional, differentiated customer experiences. GCSG comprises of local sales and marketing, travel and lifestyle services, and global consumer products including lending, cobrands, and premium products and benefits, as well as the teams which develop and support the digital, risk, and information management capabilities across American Express. 
US Consumer Services: This team is responsible for making membership essential by creating and delivering our suite of differentiated products & services. This team drives the strategy, sourcing, and delivery of proprietary lend, cobrand, and premium consumer products and enterprise benefits to American Express members, with a focus on driving daily relevance and backing in their lives.  
  Preferred Skills & Experience  
Demonstrated interest in card, lend or membership focused products (I.e. travel, dining, etc.) 
Accountability for the end-to-end experience, immersed in the customer experience and performance metrics 
Great team player who is naturally curious about how things work, flexible, and comfortable with ambiguity 
Consistently seeks feedback from a diverse group of colleagues and partners, demonstrating clear actions taken to respond  
Independent thinker who’s organized, has great attention to detail, and can multi-task 
Strong analytical, problem-solving/quantitative skills 
Willing to take risks, experiment, and share fresh perspectives 
Proficient in analytical and presentation tools, including Excel and PowerPoint 
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, and ability to present ideas clearly  
  Requirements/Qualifications 
Currently enrolled in a full-time Graduate degree program  
Students must have a graduation date between December 2023 and June 2024 
  Our team will review completed applications on a rolling basis. We appreciate your patience while we consider your application and will be in contact with you by April 30th.  
 
Employment eligibility to work with American Express in the U.S. is required as the company will not pursue visa sponsorship for these positions.

Passion for shipping quality software fast and frequently. 
Attention to detail. 
  We back our colleagues with the support they need to thrive, professionally and personally. That’s why we have Amex Flex, our enterprise working model that provides greater flexibility to colleagues while ensuring we preserve the important aspects of our unique in-person culture. title: Full Stack Engineer - React & NodeJS - Digital Experience Engineering
description:
At American Express, we know that with the right backing, people and businesses have the power to progress in incredible ways. Whether we’re supporting our customers’ financial confidence to move ahead, taking commerce to new heights, or encouraging people to explore the world, our colleagues are constantly redefining what’s possible — and we’re proud to back each other every step of the way.
When you join Team Amex, you become part of a diverse community of over 60,000 colleagues, all with a common goal to deliver an exceptional customer experience every day. Here, you’ll learn and grow as we champion your meaningful career journey with programs, benefits, and flexibility to back you personally and professionally. Every colleague share in the company’s success.
Together, we’ll win as a team, striving to uphold our company values and powerful backing promise to our customers, communities, and each other every day. And we’ll do it with integrity and in an environment where everyone is seen, heard and feels like they truly belong.
Join #TeamAmex and let’s lead the way together.
Responsible for contacting clients with overdue accounts to secure the settlement of the account. Also they do preventive work to avoid future overdues with accounts that have a high exposure.
Serving as a core member of an agile team that drives user story analysis and develops responsive web applications.
Performing hands-on software development, typically spending most of time actually writing code and unit tests, doing proof of concepts, conducting code reviews, and testing in ongoing sprints
Performing ongoing refactoring of code, utilizing visualization and other techniques to fast track concepts, and delivering continuous improvement
Developing deep understanding of integrations with other systems and platforms within the supported domains
Bring a culture of innovation, ideas, and continuous improvement
Challenging status quo, demonstrate risk taking, and implement creative ideas
Good attitude, communication, willingness to learn and collaborate
Manage your own time, and work well both independently and as part of a team.
Work closely with product managers, back-end and other front-end developers to implement versatile solutions to tricky web development problems
Finalizing HTML prototypes into Web Applications by integrating with back-end services and functionality
Embrace emerging standards while promoting standard methodologies and consistent framework usage.
Please note, Salary increases in case of a lateral move are provided only on an exception basis and in line with compensation guidelines.
As part of our diverse tech team, you can architect, code and ship software that makes us an essential part of our customers’ digital lives.  Here, you can work alongside talented engineers in an open, supportive, inclusive environment where your voice is valued, and you make your own decisions on what tech to use to solve challenging problems.  American Express offers a range of opportunities to work with the latest technologies and encourages you to back the broader engineering community through open source.  And because we understand the importance of keeping your skills fresh and relevant, we give you dedicated time to invest in your professional development.  Find your place in technology of #TeamAmex.
Minimum Qualifications
BS or MS degree in computer science, or equivalent 3-4 years of work experience
2-3 years’ experience working in JavaScript and able to demonstrate good JavaScript knowledge
Ability to demonstrate good web fundamentals & knowledge of DOM
Experience writing adaptive and responsive UI applications
Knowledge of HTML5, React, Redux, Express, Middleware with recent experience in ES6
2-3 years experience in writing JavaScript applications in Node.js
Experience with REST based interfaces.
1-2 years experience with Test Driven Development (TDD) / Behavior Driven Development (BDD) practices, unit testing, functional testing, system integration testing, regression testing, GUI testing, web service testing, and browser compatibility testing, including frameworks such as, WebDriverIO, Cucumber.JS
Experience with Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery(CI/CD)
2-3 yrs working experience in an Agile or SAFe development environment
Experience in a11y and I18N is a plus
GraphQL knowledge and experience is a plus.
Salary Range: $70,000.00 to $135,000.00 annually + bonus + benefits
The above represents the expected salary range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we'll consider your location, experience, and other job-related factors.
American Express is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran status, disability status, age, or any other status protected by law.
We back our colleagues with the support they need to thrive, professionally and personally. That’s why we have Amex Flex, our enterprise working model that provides greater flexibility to colleagues while ensuring we preserve the important aspects of our unique in-person culture. Depending on role and business needs, colleagues will either work onsite, in a hybrid model (combination of in-office and virtual days) or fully virtually.

US Job Seekers/Employees - Click here to view the “EEO is the Law” poster and supplement and the Pay Transparency Policy Statement.
Employment eligibility to work with American Express in the U.S. is required as the company will not pursue visa sponsorship for these positions.
